uxAnpJZEljxEnh84ZvA2PQ.text: I'm so happy I found another taco place in Nevada that I can frequent!!! This place rivals Taco El Gordo in so many ways. The restaurant is HUGE. I'm talking tons of space, and they serve alcohol :D I came just as they were having their 5-7 pm HH ($3 for a Corona light and $4 for a Michelada). The way you order the taco is the same process as El Gordo where each meat has it's own station. I absolutely loved their salsa bar with tons of sauce and spicy veggie options (#1 game changer for me). The only con I have to say about this place is that the lengua taco needs to be less dry, more tender and don't just assume that I want pineapple on my taco (ew!).   However, their al pastor and cabeza tacos were delicious *cry*. I wish I can eat tacos everyday and not gain weight. The cherry on top of this entire place was that they serve ELOTE!!! I repeat guys, they have ELOTE here. Thank you so much for existing Taco y Taco (:

faiMGOSGNNRiAi4RpH0PdQ.text: Visited on 9/13/13, cool spot very spacious and unique. Plenty of seating space, but seems like it can get crowded. Food was good, although I was disappointed with the al pastor meat. The marinade was not as good as I expected, had a weird smell to it.  I recommend their lengua and tripas, make sure you ask the guy to dip the tripa back in the fryer for an extra minute. Decent salsa bar and  Service was good. I would go back, but not ordering the al pastor again.

ZO8wrNFnWH6g6v9yX9cgmg.text: It's fresh comfort food, close to authentic as it get. Little oily but was good.. Not much to say.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

Y6zaiLK7LnsrNKAQ367ZGA.text: These tacos are packed with flavor. I loved the choices I had here and everything is very affordable. Although 2 out of 3 of the tacos I had were a bit dry, the flavors were delicious and the sauces saved them.   The al pastor seems like a favorite here. They cut the pork in front of you and top it with pineapples, which is super delicious and adds a contrast with salty and sweet flavors. The pork was a bit dry but was still good, especially with the spicy pastor salsa from the salsa bar.   The carne asada was also quite dry but was a solid choice. It was marinated well and the guacamole on top made it better. The beef was sliced thinner than I am used too but it made each bite work.   My absolute favorite is the lengua. It's moist, tender, and so flavorful. It works well with the avocado sauce and just melts in the mouth. To some, it may be fatty but it was balanced well with the toppings and the homemade tortillas.   Along with these, I tried a bit of the chorizo, which also was dry. It had a lot of spices, though, so it was still very good. The service is very friendly and helpful, and there is plenty of seating. I didn't get to see the upstairs area, but downstairs was elegant and clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. (Top to bottom) Lengua, chorizo, carne asada, al pastor
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Three lines

HTqHKcUek_EDJQHoIChiTg.text: Man oh man was I disappointed today with the al pastor. It was tasteless and it wasn't sliced how it usually should come. We got fatty chunks of meat and was super hard to bite into. The reason for the 3 stars is the asada was on point and the customer service was great. Seems like they changed the al pastor please go back to how it was before this al pastor sucked. New staff every time we come in i guess that kills the consistency.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Big fat piece of tasteless al pastor

Wvr9v3kbra0OFdooV2zGCw.text: Being from Southern California I've been spoiled by Mexican food. I had a hard time finding good tacos out here but Taco Y Taco is my go to spot. The al pastor is absolutely insane. Get them Vampiro style and unbutton your pants lol. Will be back for sure. Great customer service and decent prices. Only complaint is on Mondays they have live music but it is way too loud. Having kids we had to sit in the corner and were talking over eachother.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

1m9ENG2hcMlMN9HXRrrIzg.text: The best tacos in town folks. Everything is super bueno! Starting with the quesadillas, the loaded nachos, and the vampiro tacos... OMG to die for! The staff is very friendly and helpful. Always smiling and attentive. I absolutely love this place and it's my go to spot AT LEAST once a week ( the other 6 days o try to diet lol). 5 stars, keep it up guys. You're amazing!!!

w77ouH8Etx4fAdn0TGYMmw.text: Dirty!!!! Tables were super dirty and disgusting. Trash was overflowing, liquid seeping onto the floor. I went to get ice and there was black specks in the ice! I reported it to the cashier; she gave me a new cup but did nothing to rectify the situation. Numerous customers continued to get ice. Could be a possible mold issue, but they did nothing to fix the problem! Do not eat there unless you want to risk food borne illness. I've never had an issue with the establishment on Eastern.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Trash overflowing. No attempt the clean it up!

wcJxS0WdNygDXTQ0p--4Pg.text: The food was amazing ,everything from the tacos made in front of you fresh,to the corn it was amazing!!!

wR5AfXjUoRtaZ3-MGNIZUQ.text: One word; Delish! Been to both locations, this one twice. The Carne asada fries are to die for!! Tacos are on point. I've only been 3 times, in the last 3 years. Not because I don't like it, but because I do and it's good and fattening!!!

3l7zS4byLnO2UWpOgkAXYQ.text: This place is just bomb. Had an asada taco, Azteca taco, al pastor mula. They have delicious little toppings like frijoles de la olla. Just do it! You won't be disappointed.

_qyMLSSPtPULi6XrVqlhSA.text: Street tacos for any day and any mood. Tacos for DAYS! Juicy meats, quick service, crunchy chips, fresh pico de gallo and guacamole, customized burritos and anything you can dream up.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

mPM_84_ZXz5yzqRJJx5-LQ.text: Great tacos but you might end up eating them cold! Their ordering system isn't very efficient. You can't order everything you want in one place, you have to go to different "stations" to order different items. Hence, by the time you get your quesadilla, your tacos are cold. God forbid you want something from yet a third station!  Additionally, they don't have translations for what each of the meats are, only whether they are pork or beef. Careful, you could end up ordering beef brain and not even know it! Yummy food, lousy set up.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Barbacoa tacos with &#34;everything&#34;.

Z0xzVsPO9zf8YDH5xJ3D6Q.text: I went here for lunch and ended up spending $19 for some pretty basic tasting Mexican food. There is nothing authentic about this place just over priced Mexican food. The food I could handle but the customer service was the worst I have experienced in a while. The girl working the register was sucking down her boba tea while ringing me up then wanted to complain when I made a comment about the price when she said $19!!! She even went as far as saying she canceled the food cause it's "too much" I will never be back for this over priced Mexican food with the rudest customer service in the shopping center

5hrZs9qoIf7JStzVuNaP5Q.text: Love the atmosphere and of course love the food! Truly authentic Mexican food! I've had pretty much everything on their menu and I've never been disappointed, they make their salsas in-house! The food is always so fresh and of course delicious!

9F7oDFT9SC2Omo-GpOuyeQ.text: Yelp told me to go here.  Yelp said I would like it.  Yelp was right.    First of all the space that housed this restaurant was very clean and very large.  In fact, there was a 2nd floor with more tables that overlook the entire area.  The decor was nice.  The staff greets you when you walk in and the staff behind the counters were also very friendly.   There were separate aisles or stations if you may call it that where you order your food.  We had the vampiro al pastor which was pretty much pork with all the toppings, sandwiched between two crunchy corn tortillas.   My wife described the taste of the pork as if eating sweet bbq sparerib meat.  I can go with that.    We also had standard tacos, filled wither either chicken or steak.  While okay on its own, their amazing toppings bar brought the tacos up a few notches.   Imagine Roberto's but with 3 x more stuff.  So many types of hot sauces, grilled onions, beans, etc.   I really liked their options here.  Their carne asada fries were a bit underwhelming and a bit over priced.  That was probably the only miss about this place.  To top it all off, we ordered one of their elotes.  It was seasoned in chili powder, butter, and cheese.  Loved it.  Satisfied with this joint, Taco y taco will be my go to when I want some authentic tasting Mexican food!

yn9xjp23w1a6VTL72auh9g.text: Nice chill place, very clean and welcoming. Though the food was not great. Meats were flavorless, sauces too.

ckOZE14ykNJ6cG3R94bmQA.text: The food is good and so is the atmosphere but paying that much for mexican food is just crazy.. they really need to lower their prices

N-8TEGE-zdyLxg59R-ZdFQ.text: The best part of my day: after my job is eat three or four Tacos De asada and one Beer in Taco y Taco !!!! OMG 100% make me happy!!!

Be27FoUCe2N2UDNoht9WpA.text: I love this place! Their service is super friendly and attentive; super clean for a taco joint! Unfortunately, when I got home to eat the food I ordered I found a curly black hair :( GROSS!!!!  I still recommend this place for its service and reputation. A hair found in food happens to everyone and is something very common. Its not something horrendous like rats! It's a great place but I'm still very disgusted.

rMhHTO8P2CA8EuBkEziJVw.text: This place is horrible. The wait in line is fucking ridiculous. They let people order from the bar and skip all the people that have been waiting in line

K6OFDw-aVa_dV53lTiWrjA.text: I walk into taco y taco and immediately like the concept of an upscale taco restaurant with full service alcohol bar, salsa bar, and live mariachi, however I feel their tacos are not that great. The restaurant feels full of promise with experience but falls short on the food in my opinion. The tacos are not as flavorful as I had anticipated. They use a similar concept to tacos el Gordo where there are different lines for different styles of tacos. The only problem I have at locations with this concept is your first set of tacos are cold by the time you are done getting other tacos- or for that matter anything else. Same idea if you order burritos or other hot items you order it at counter and stand around for quite a while waiting for your food to be ready. The only item I order there is carne Asada fries.

VkkhzcH6FnpHpW0vyyDQVw.text: I had such an amazing dinner chowing down on the Azteca Gran Taco. A great atmosphere and awesome street tacos! I can't wait to come back! There are so many options I wanted them all!

ukKOJ_IcINcRpe7fVP_0CQ.text: This place is located on the left (north) part of the lot and this is probably one of the most heavily trafficked lots in Henderson.  If it is I'm sure this restaurant is one of the main reasons. It's 7pm on Saturday and its a PACKED HOUSE. Don't worry you'll get a seat upstairs or downstairs. There's even a party of about 20 celebrating something. It would be cool to sit near the railing to look down on the chaos.   Yes its chaotic here. The inside is as huge as the outside lets off. There are about 4 separate lines for things I have never heard of. I had to ask a couple of regulars what was what so I knew where to stand. It looked like one line but I guess one line was just real popular.  This is where I deduct a star. It could be better managed. Maybe have a greeter direct newbies or good signage but definitely a better system of ordering. I was waiting along the salsa bar the whole time I waited and inevitability was in someone's way haha. The lines or the salsa bar need to be rearranged. I suggest it be put against a wall but I couldn't tell you where.  It definitely looks like mass confusion.  When it came time for me to get my salsa there was someone in line in MY way lol. For anybody that cares it's colder upstairs then it is downstairs and they carry liquor.   They have Barbacoa but not just that. There's like 3 or 4 types of beef I've never heard of lol. There's also like 3 or so types of pork.  I guess I'm saying you'll have meat options.  The place definitely gives off a factory vibe where they are pushing out tons of product. I do have to say they are efficient with the food.  The food is definitely good and the salsa bar is also good but both aren't excellent and could be improved.  My wife thought the Carnitas were flavorless but the Barbacoa had plenty of spice.  The value is excellent and the choices are OK.  Overall I would say this is a good place to eat and with a few tweaks here or there it could definitely earn five stars from me and I'm sure others as well.   OK I'll shut up now

_fg0fCj7KgNOXAyGujB3gw.text: What's not to love? Everything tastes fresh and authentic. I love the carnita tacos with pineapple, horchata, carne asada, and the elote (Mexican corn). Ordering is a little confusing. There are different stations for each meat so it can be a little chaotic but just grab a tray and get in a line. You won't regret it!

Ox-X_OzC76gb0nmL1Vcs7g.text: This place rivals Gordo, but is less crowded.  The carne asada mulas, and the carnitas mulas are amazing!  My friends like the corn on the cob also!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Carne asada mulas...yumm

Ude6n4iYqvZLUXd94OFFEw.text: Way too over priced. $2.75 per drink. Not very happy with service either. You sell tacos and bowls with meat but you don't have chicken? Super unhappy with this place. Its my first time here and I had high expectations. Its also too loud to where you can't here the servers or your family. Still baffles me that you don't have chicken.. ridiculous.

AR_oZ0Gx5P3NDrthymxmnQ.text: 4.5 stars: TACOS! Came here as an alternative to Tacos El Gordo and the line went much faster - went on a Saturday night around 8 and had my food in front of me in seven minutes. Highly recommend getting a vampiro - it was my first time having one and the crispy shells are so satisfying - and also a sleeper hit was the fish tacos, which is light and fresh grilled whitefish.  The al pastor is the real star and you should hit up that line repeatedly and often. I also had the buche, which wasn't as tender as I've had before and also quite salty, and the suadero (always pleased to get brisket) tacos. I wish they had horchata or an agua de fresco on site but the grapefruit Jarritos went down easy, and you can get craft beers! Nice atmosphere, a little sterile than I'm used to for tacos, but that's not a bad thing as you really do feel like you can linger and get some more tacos without worrying about parking or crowds.

yrw7xmlr2rLDl-vgDZslnQ.text: I lived in this area for many years until my husband and I moved to another side of town several months ago.  Taco Y Taco was one of our favorite spots to frequent, as it was close to home and we loved a lot of their menu offerings, especially the tacos.  It is my understanding that the family who owns and operates this restaurant was also in the butcher business, which makes sense... there was something different about the meat here.  It WAS good.  The other night, we happened to be  in our old stomping grounds and were too excited to have the tacos we missed so much.  But we were disappointed.  Not sure if it was just an off night, but the meat lacked flavor, and didn't have the nice charred flavor of a grill that we remembered.  It instead tasted steamed or boiled even.    The place always seems unnecessarily chaotic, and we never minded it.  We can tolerate a less than stellar atmosphere if the food is great.  However, the fact that they missed the mark with our order had us wanting to leave quickly.    Not sure if we will be back again.

tcmceVVkMPAAUoHdGla61g.text: Such a great place. I highly recommend the Tacos al Pastor and street corn. The environment is great and the drinks are fantastic.  The line system is tricky. But don't let it deter you. Just line up in front of whatever you would like and then take it to the cashier.

zHYQqHFUYlKUweBVFccD_w.text: My brother on the east side turned me on to this place.  I'm on the west side of Vegas and don't get over to his side to explore the restaurant scene as much as I'd like.  We are both Mexican food junkies and suckers for good Al Pastor.  The place is larger than you might think.  The flow of the restaurant is a little off, and ordering is a bit confusing.  You would think everyone would get a tray and start at station 1, but it didn't seem to work that way.  Folks were "cutting in line" at other stations and it seemed to slow things up.  Station1 was the Al Pastor, and I tried two of them.  Watching the prep told you how authentic it was and how awesome it was going to taste.  Station 2 was other proteins/preparations, like Carne Asada and Carnitas. I tried one of the Carnitas.  The prep cook pulled a nice chunk out of a bath of juice, chopped it up and piled it high.  On to station 3, where you could get burrito bowls, Mexican corn and other side.  One Mexican corn for me.  Oh, and beer on tap and in the bottle.  One cold bottle of Modelo.  Does this sound like a feast or what?  On to the salsa bar, which includes warm beans.  I wanted a better selection of salsa, and larger cups to put it into.  The tacos were wonderful.  The tortillas were perfect, with just a few seconds on the grill.  The meat was so flavorful.  The corn was cooked and seasoned perfectly.  The prices were right.  This is the real deal.  I'll be back.

TF4PPx1JBJpyRq6CYo4CTQ.text: Def one of my favorite joints in town! :) The Eastern location is on par with the original on Tropicana, except this one has a full bar and a gorgeous interior decoration. In other words: a major upgrade!  It's about 3-4x the size of the first restaurant and includes an upstairs dining area, which is great for larger parties. The menu is the same (with the exception of the drink menu, of course) and service is still stationary, where you approach separate counters for different things, but is just as friendly. Don't be afraid to ask questions!  On special occasions, like Cinco De Mayo, they have live mariachi music & awesome specials. They also run sweet deals during their daily 5-7 PM Happy Hour and every Tuesday, aka TACO TUESDAY! Which has $2 al pastor or chicken street tacos, $2 cheese quesadillas, & cheap drinks.

Vo23S4rLO_DZsi1ri0S1_Q.text: These tacos are unique. Not exactly the best thing my taste buds have experienced but they're ok. The service was good, I remember when this was the republic, they've totally redone the place and made it very unique. That seems like the only thing I can think of to describe this place. Very unique. My friend really enjoyed it so 4 stars to taco y taco

HWpDCssUcKX6Q-SwYVLBzQ.text: This place is so delicious!! Came here for the first time on Cinco de Mayo, and it was jam packed.   My friend and I found a place at the bar to enjoy, and we definitely did. I got 1 al pastor & 1 pork belly. So delicious!! Came back here today for lunch with some friends and the experience was pretty much the same. Great food, jam packed with people. This time I tried the elote (corn on the cob). Make sure to get it with everything on it! The al pastor too - the pineapple counter acts the heat and makes it so good!  The lines seem to confuse everyone though. At each window, you find a different kind of taco/food. So just pay attention otherwise you'll be in the wrong line.  If it was closer to me, I'd definitely be here all the time. I'd for sure recommend this to all my friends!

Rpir3XEfzTJmInffMLTQ6w.text: This new taco bar/cocktail bar concept..is brilliant!  When my girlfriend mentioned that we were headed to meet friends for dinner and we were going to Taco y Taco, I imagined the normal small taco shack with great food as you would find at their other location, with underwhelming decor.   I was overwhelmed when I entered Taco y Taco on Eastern. This place is big, two levels with plenty of seating and you'll want to spend some time here.  It has a nice ambiance with cool modern chandelier lighting and dark accents.  It's a surprise that their tacos are still only 2.25!?!  We sat at the bar waiting for friends.  We had some happy hour beers and the bartenders were super nice.  Once we got around to eating, we went through the taco bar.  I had 3 tacos: one al pastor, a carne and a carnitas.  My fave of the 3 was the carnitas.  I wasn't overly impressed by the al pastor.  I've definitely had better.  My gf had tripa, lengua and an al pastor.  She seemed to enjoy them and had the same feelings about the al pastor. This is definitely a great spot for something quick, something slow and some late night dining.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Taco bar
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Happy hour everyday!!

8LfSFcniC4tweEv_0ISMxQ.text: Wow this place is awesome. The food is sooooooo good. Nothing like it in Las Vegas. MUST TRY!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Dang sooooo good

BKD0OzUdiQn17sD2eANhGQ.text: Sooo good! Traditional meat options.  The ordering can be a little confusing upon coming in. Different windows for different items. There's alcohol served. Lots of seating plus upstairs seating! The street style corn is phenomenal!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexican corn
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

j07z0CeyE5vUQNS9LGOVuw.text: The price and food were delicious. The atmosphere is out of this world. See photos!  Everything is fresh, made to order. The salsa & sides are delicious and plentiful. The beer selection is a little weak, imho. But this place is worth the visit. We had beef tacos. All four of us lived it. & the price is really reasonable for what you get.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. It&#39;s a kicking salsa bar.  HOT HOT
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Head upstairs.
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Even an upstairs.

hkXndx4nneYSkWCLHan9Fg.text: After all the hype my husband and I and our two friends finally tried this place. Now we see what everyone was talking about! The ordering was a little confusing but the cook explained everything to us and even let us sample a few meats. I ordered a couple tacos, rice, and corn...and oh my it was delicious! I meant to take a picture but it looked so yummy I totally forgot! We will definitely be back!

V0aRL42Rc7ZUqb3Qha2OOA.text: This place is the real deal. When you walk in it is very clean and has a really nice decor. They have different stations for meats burritos, etc.   I tried several tacos the carne asada, carnitas, and al pastor. The best was the carne asada. We got a side of chips and guac which were plain and it turned brown pretty fast. We obviously had to try the street corn. I don't even like corn and it was sooooo good. cheesy and a little spice YUM YUM!   There really isn't anything to comment about the service because they don't really wait on you after you leave the food stations. It is also pretty nice that they have a bar there.

QbV9kSfhu6iH9qbwtK55aw.text: Cool atmosphere, upstairs seating and a salsa bar. Fresh meat cooked right before your eyes and they even have vegetarian options. Try the fish tacos there to die for. Make sure you get them loaded. Fresh corn on the cob street cart style and a cold beer to wash it all down. YUMMY!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Fish tacos loaded super yummy!!
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Fish tacos, mexican rice anf fresh corn on the cob loaded!

HXnyOq07tVSOmsz-_B0y_A.text: Great tacos, great food, great staff, always clean.  DJ spinning, and margaritas are AMAZING. Worth the visit. We enjoy stopping by for a light lunch after church on the way home.

v1iMl6qFZfc1A27CzuQSqQ.text: Clean. Amazing clean. It might be too clean for my liking.  The service is great. They got it lockdown. The homies for sure.  The food. I can't complain. I've had every protein. Top 3 goes lengua, tripa, and buche. Bomb dot com.  The mariachi band on Mondays is a nice addition. It automatically makes everything super authentic.

y414ERqWeyNqXVo8Xf1PAw.text: By far one of my favorite places to come eat and have a good drink! Everyone is always so nice, and the food never disappoints! The price is fair too! Love when they have a DJ too gives such a fun experience!

u6KXnKXeRCc4ZUwa6f82AA.text: Found this place on yelp.   Super great location, a mile from our house. I love that they have a full, and I do mean FULL, bar. Their tequila selection is impressive, to say the least!! Our bar tender, Jose, was incredible! Very attentive, gave us all kinds of samples, really friendly!! Their food, also incredible!! We tried the al pastor taco (meat, onions, cilantro and pineapple)...not a huge pork fan, but it was super tasty! Also tried one of their carne Asada bowls, yummy!! The one downside of the bowl was the cheese. It was pretty much the Kraft shredded fiesta mix you can buy at the grocery store. The carne Asada was great though!! Not fatty and very flavorful. My girlfriend got the chips and guacamole. Not a huge fan myself, but was definitely impressed. The guacamole was filled with cilantro and chunks of tomato. The chips were homemade and warm when they came out.  Overall, was very impressed and can't wait to come back again!!!

QM9_tkaOcYMmYDY9bVkvXg.text: This place is bomb but when I saw it had a C for the Health Department that grossed me out. you have to be really dirty to get a C. wouldn't go back til it's an A.

9yDOMzcrun4gICslnS2YkA.text: Stopped in during the lunch rush today, and it was packed! Seems word got out pretty quickly. However, the line moves fast, so you don't wait long. You start over on the opposite end of the cash register, order your tacos, move over and order your sides, bowls, etc., then pay. It's a fast and easy system.  Their salsa bar is awesome, with salsas and condiments to fit any taste. My only recommendation would be to put labels somehow on the salsas for those who don't know salsas and accidently dump the wrong kind on their food. For those of us who can tell them apart, you'll be fine.  Their beer taps aren't turned on yet, so if you want beer, they have bottles. You can also get mixed drinks later in the day (their manager said the bartender didn't come in until later).  The tacos are tasty, and if you don't like cilantro, onions and guacamole on them, tell them in advance. I wish they put a little more meat in them, but for $2.25 a taco, you can't go wrong.

2MuTmaJnNoogbIv5P_vpIA.text: Cheap, authentic & delicious food!  I thought I was back in LA for a minute!  The street tacos are made to order & $2.25 each. We came on a Thursday around 9:30pm & they had live music, well kind of. It's one guy signing & playing keyboard. Full bar, plenty of seating down or upstairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexican Coke $2.45

fzay4yGvP9prOzZgnnLDdA.text: Tacos are amazing! Even though the ordering process was a little confusing. I didn't however appreciate the fact that the staff doesn't really engage with their clientele. I was waiting a whole 8 mins with no one else behind me before I had to approach the gentlemen to order. But he was respectful after I got his attention.

GiDfeKxPy3a_7moGxzar7w.text: Been wanting to try this place out for a long time and finally made it today. They have street tacos of all kinds of meat, burritos, nachos, tostadas etc. We had tacos el pastor, asada fries, carnitas taco, and tostadas de buche. Loved the tacos el pastor! They had great flavor. Also liked that we could order beers or whatever. If u like authentic street tacos then this is the place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Buche tostadas, el pastor tacos, and carnitas taco
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Asada fries

fqI-JZ1krNI0UA5-UoTkew.text: The el pastor vampiro's might be one of my favorite things to eat here ever!  If you are with out the kids, try to grab a seat at their bar. The two guys that work on Saturday nights really have some great recommendations and can whip up a mean cocktail!! Be patient, their master pieces need a little time since they actually muddle real fruit and mix their own seasonings.

WgvhITwZEPdsUK1KEcu1FA.text: Good Mexican street tacos & sides. My favorite were the adobada mulas & adobada fries. It's clean & casual with lots of seating. A good variety of salsas at the serve yourself salsa bar with spicy carrots & radishes. The only downfall is the set up for ordering. It's an "L" shape with different stations so when it's busy it can get hectic. But the food, prices & cleanliness of the place is why it is one of my family's local eats.

Bo-TJJCulkbMoPyAI4vL-A.text: Just as good as the location on Tropicana.  I suggest that you take some of the sauces and mix them. I like adding that green sour  cream guacamole with the red roasted peppers salsa.

RH6ZkOfZnlIGI7IycGKvLQ.text: Very good!  The tacos al pastor were the best and everything tastes pretty authentic.  The service okay too.  It's nice to have a cart to load up your tacos and this location has a great one.  Definitely recommend

8Ybiv2oANIe4ovtEgH9eYg.text: Great tacos, fresh and tasty. Service was fast and friendly. It was late and we had a jones for tacos. THIS is the right spot! Will go again on our next late night of gambling.

uCTYLhAgWzuQWfylAFhArw.text: OMG, reminds me of home in Chicago where you can find great food in small neighborhood locations of Pilsen or Humbolt Park. Great well flavored food served simply. The prices are super reasonable

MOYHYxsE3y-B3m7k3edQCA.text: Meh...Food was OK.  Chipotle or Zabas is better.  Environment is great and the patio was delightful.  But, I really do not like the "station" set-up.  I was so confused, and, didn't find it easy to navigate, at least for their quality of food.  If the food was to die for I would expend the energy necessary to figure out which line to stand in, get my food and then go stand in a second line to pay the cashier.  I really don't like that there isn't waitstaff, especially for drinks!  To go up to the cashier each time is a waste of a good buzz.  Maybe great for some, but, not for me...

SsAY7oT0gmh_fDEA7PYUCA.text: This is def as good as it gets in Vegas... Came here for the first time with my bff last night and we loved it! Great food, good service, cool and clean atmosphere! I am in love with the Al Pastor tacos. Also tried their horchata, Barbacoa taco and elote... Everything was indeed yummy. Got some to go for my husband: lengua, asada, barbacoa and al pastor tacos and he was feeling em too! Interested in trying out their burritos next time. This is seriously our new spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al Pastor and barbacoa tacos and street corn with everything (elote)
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

_umsa1El7y8ffPfIVQxVqg.text: First there was Pepe's Tacos, then there was Tacos El Gordo and now there's this!!  Best part is the restaurant being only a block away from where I live so I don't have to drive all the way up north for damn good tacos.  Located at the former Republic Kitchen & Bar establishment along South Eastern Blvd, this is definitely one of the better looking taco shops out there.  I like how the new occupants kept the same floor plan from the old bar and added few Latin modifications to suit their concept.  Plenty of seats downstairs, upstairs and even outside.    This place has several stations for certain cuts of meats from which you can order any way you desire: taco, burrito, nachos, fries, bowl, and vampiro.  Salsa bar is also impressive with various sides and 8 different sauces!!  Thirsty? They have a full bar and an extensive list of beer on tap or in a bottle.  Happy hour is from 6-8 p.m. daily with live mariachi on Mondays and DJ spinning on weekends.  I always get tacos with cabeza (head), lengua (tough) and chicharron (skin) anywhere I go so I had to try them out from this place.  The first two were quite tasty and really tender.  As far as the chicharron, they actually add crispy pork rinds which was a first since other taquerias normally just serve the taco with soggy pork skins.  What also got me hyped up is the fact that they have elotes since I no longer have to track down this dude who sells them from a shopping cart!!  Overall, Taco Y Taco is one of the best Mexican joints in the valley.  I would give them six stars if I could.

3KfBBrwg5_4dnPrac1dUtg.text: Don't venture away from the tacos or you will be sorely disappointed. Honestly, it is better than Taco Bell but falls short of Los Tacos and Tacos el Gordo by a long shot. Great seating and looks very clean but the meat was luke warm and the guacamole was flavorless, if not unappetizing. The Mexican street corn was pretty beat as well--Cattle corn boiled too long and again kept luke warm. I am a huge fan of Mexican food and this place has been disappointing both times I have come. The price point is also relatively high to other great taco restaurants. I gave them 2 stars purely for the cleanliness.

9qR9iwRReQo-iGIScA25zw.text: This place is a hit and miss. When I havent had it for awhile, its amazing! When I've had it too much, its a miss. I am a regular though and quite a creature of habit. I do love their chiccharones tacos, those are addicting. I'd skip their seafood tacos (the shrimp is rubbery and a little slimy and tastes like it was just defrosted). My other favorite here is their carnitas tacos, those are pretty amazing! The salsa bar could be a little better. When you order chips and salsa, make sure you ask for fresh ones.... they tend to be hours old and stale- best to ask for a new batch. Great atmosphere, customer service is pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

_um5oqJEhrFAGQYm3LayoQ.text: This place is on the verge of five stars.  Here is what went right with the place: great tacos, taco stations were quick, salsa bar was good and plentiful, they had different creations (vampiros), and their nachos were spot on. Here is what is wrong with the place: no fish tacos, the cashiers were horrible-they couldn't figure out the card machine and it took five of them crowding around the machine to figure out how to work it, and did I mention no fish tacos?  I feel like that is a must!  I will go back... But I hope they at least figure out the credit card machine before I do.

MNtBq2pGwNYvs7QeQwt9rA.text: This place is for the taco conoseiur... They have it all: beef, pork, fish, chicken, and shrimp. You line up in line, order your tacos, and they make them right in front of you. The tacos are small - street style - but pack a serious amount of flavor!  Hubby ordered the chicken and carne asada tacos. I ordered the shrimp and fish tacos. They also sell Mexican street corn, too, but beware - if you want it cut off of the cob they charge you an extra $2 just for that.  The tacos were flavorful and perfectly seasoned. The meat was nicely accompanied by lettuce, pico, and a spicy sauce (chipotle maybe). So for 8 tacos, Mexican corn, and a coke, it came to about $35. Kind of steep, but you get what you pay for here. I will be back!

YZ5jFxKZ0t1eaG0cWCSSRg.text: Stopped in at this place today while we were in town, and wow! The building, the people that work there and the food were all amazing! This place was immaculately clean, the salsa bar was fresh and well stocked, and the tacos were spot on. We will so be coming back to this place!

yz_WtD0mPCaayz54n8RnOQ.text: Awesome. Seriously, if you like tacos look no further. Taco y taco is just off the charts good.  Been to both in town and they are both great. This place is a little more trendy, the Tropicana one is a little more authentic. But both have great street tacos.  The el pastor is so good.

0gwbk0ibs_DCq91R9yKmig.text: This only gets three stars cause the food is amazing! Other then great tasting food, place is very confusing. When you walk in there is a line that no one has any idea what line they are in. The first two are for tacos, but if you want a burrito or fish tacos you have to go to another line.  They tell you to go there but then you pass 10 people and I feel like I'm cutting everyone in line.  Everyone stood and looked at each and was  like what line are we in? Once you get to that line your suppose to be in, they don't speak English.  I ordered a carne asade burrito, and they tried to give it to someone else. I told them that's mine and he said ohhhh, and had to open it, but looked at me weird cause he did not speak English!  I would give them a 1 star but the food is amazing! Great prices too! Just really confusing.  We also came on a Tuesday night and damn if there wasent 50 kids running around up and down making a ton of noise!

dfnr6X5vFcQ0qn_vwXR_Ow.text: Overall, I would give this place 4 stars but there was a lady working today that was extremely rude. I was getting a to go order for someone in my household that couldnt leave the house and I didn't know what she wanted. The lady behind the counter looked at me frustrated even though no one was in line behind me and then she had the audacity to say "next time have your order ready." It was a last minute order and I didn't know what she wanted. It was completely uncalled for. So 3 stars because of rude wait staff.

Xc0iTUouc8gWUL_jkoiMdg.text: The food is awesome so is give that a 5 but the ordering process sort of confusing and intimidating at first :)

2ztvWibeZgNGTAKJjiJbeg.text: Great prices and ambiance. I really lined the tacos. Lots of selection and great service.

6wprrHy2BezMT3lzwYuw6Q.text: Man o man I'm as Mexican as it gets and I know about real Mexican food and let me say this tacos are fucking bomb I ordered 16 tacos I had al pastor,chorizo,lengua,cabeza,pibil,carnitas, asada and tripas and they were all Hella good I'm definitely coming back to this place every time I'm in Vegas and the vibe from the restaurant is very cool

59cFyK7y1ij9WvQ0sfVxDA.text: Came here the day after they opened. The lay out is a little confusing, since this place is essentially a taco shop in a really fancy restaurant. But the staff was really nice explaining how everything worked. We even got samples of a  few different types of meat!   After 20 minutes of indecision we went with Lengua(Tongue), Cabeza(Cheek meat), Al Pastor (Pork), and Asada tacos, along with an Al pastor bowl. We also tried all of their salsas and extras, and EVERYTHING was delicious! Their al pastor specifically was excellent, and the lengua and cabeza tacos were also great! We regretted not getting the mexican street corn since it seemed like everyone ordered it.   Definitely coming back since it's delicious food at a reasonable price. This location is also much closer to us than all the other locations around Vegas.

HuZdtNFxCpfTyuzT8QWrXA.text: The food is good, just like the original. Specifically, I really enjoy the al pastor and the fried fish. And the carnitas. Bonus points to this new location for the atmosphere. It's hip, but it's still "fast-casual" aaaand they have a full bar. Prices are very affordable ($2.50/taco, complimentary beans, $5 for a good selection of drafts), foods good, it's in my neighborhood....I'll definitely be back.

bM_bSE33UugXE33ntCB20A.text: This was an awesome find right outside the Vegas strip. It's actually on my top five taco places and the prices are super affordable. I wish there was one in LA! Great service up, nice ambience and great food! Need I say more?

vickB79vVJcsjqVjjNc7gg.text: I looooove tacos. Especially the Al Pastor tacos with extra pineapples. Yum, yum, yum!   Based on my current experience, Taco Y Taco is one the best places to get those authentic street tacos. It's like a fancier, more upscale Tacos El Gordo. It's very clean and there's a lot of seating, even a second floor and outside patio (both of which I've never sat at but would like to eventually).   Ordering is simple: you stand in the line that corresponds to the type of meat you want. It's about $2 to $2.50 for a taco. Then move down the line if you want anything extra like chips & guac, a burrito, elotes (yummy, yummy street corn), or carne asada fries!   You get your drinks at the register. They have an abundance of drinks in a bottle from the bar, cans of soda, or just the fountain drinks.   They also have a sauce bar with a non-spicy avocado sauce, hot habanero or hot pastor, and about three other sauces. So many options, all delicious.   I love coming here for tacos and will keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Sauce bar. Get the avocado sauce!
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al Pastor tacos w/extra pineapples! Yum!

KfKeHtAdobac8CDoWnTLgg.text: We love Tacos! The variety of meats and flavors made for a great Taco night! The yelp tips of choosing your line to order helped. 4 lines for 4 different choices. It's clean, spacious, and well signed. We stood back and made our selections then each of us took one line and ordered items for the whole group. We each walked away with a different favorite. One Al Pastor, one pollo, carne Asada, one Barbacoa.They were good- not the best we have ever had, but good. We would go back if we lived here!

IK4UtF8x0GWlxZC8oSMSJg.text: Favorite things to order: mushroom & soyrizo tacos, elote (street corn), and horchata!  I love hip places that have a variety of vegetarian/vegan options. These tacos are so yummy. The mushroom ones come with cheese and grilled mushrooms and have these savory greasy (in a good way!) flavor and sauce that runs out when your eating.   The soyrizo is spicy and "meaty" and you can add whatever other toppings to make it how you like.  The avocado sauce at the free salsa it creamy and tops off the spicy dishes.   The corn here is the best I've ever had, no nonsense and just done right. Same goes for the horchata which is creamy and sweet and tastes homemade not like the bottled version you can get at other places.

micmI54Kq0YzJpW2EqAEGA.text: Tacos were pretty good, the organization needed a bit of work. It was very confusing the cashier tried to explain the way they work and their system is just really kind of crazy.

SbQjmiWuD53zhPKKoGONQQ.text: The service was good. It took some time to order but the workers were polite and respectful. The tacos were amazing! The vegan options were also very good. I appreciate how good the Elotes was because it was so good.

4skTRRyN7t9dotD0Pk3GFA.text: This place is the authentic chipotle lol! They have the same things as chipotle like the bowls, tacos and burritos, with all the same choices and it works the same way but they also have a lot more too! I got the bowl with vegetables, white rice, black beans, pic de gallo and guacamole. It was good but nothing too amazing. What was phenomenal though, was the corn on the cob!! You have to get that if you come here. On the downside, the place was very noisy with music blasting and people talking. I'd say take your food to go.

LGqJSw2Ue8aSlr5_iQGGjQ.text: Any other day I would give Taco Y Taco a 5 star, but not today. I was craving this place and I was on this side of town (live in Summerlin) so I stopped by. I ordered a 3 three tacos and began to devour my first taco. I was about half way through when I bit down on something that I couldn't tell if it was meat or a foreign object. Well, it was the latter  I proceeded to pull out of my mouth about a 2in piece of what they said was plastic from the meat or tortilla wrapper. They refunded my money and I went to sit down and finish my other tacos, but had lost my appetite. I'm not going to let this deter me from going back, but I think I'll give it a few months and next time will inspect my food before eating it and you should do the same.

3CmFaLC0_BgtXcYjIzGxbQ.text: Dodd was fresh and tasty. The system with three lines is very inconvenient and confusing. Need to locate the salsa bar away from the lines

pWy_GtDcu6-i8aS0YE2tSw.text: I get it, taco is in the name, but they should still know how to make a quesadilla.  Hint number one:  You put CHEESE / QUESO in it. That being said, their customer service is awful; the staff gets annoyed when you ask them questions about the confusing menu and line system.  They don't explain the menu properly when you order something or that you have to pay for your bar drinks separately.    There's a lot better mexican food out there. Seriousy, how do f**k up a quesadilla?!?!!?

c3igh__cHX3wlYq4hsrm1Q.text: This is an alternative to tacos el gordo. Since this location is much closer to me. The location is in a pretty nice area with many other food choices but I always come to this area for tacos! The ordering system might be confusing at first but so is all the other taco shops in town.   I always tend to order the same thing: al pastor tacos, elite and a michelada! They're all so good. I used to get other tacos but I prefer to stick with my usuals because they never fail me!  I highly recommend this place if you're in the area or craving some tacos but can't get to tacos el gordo!

MtfZfg-HiGPaA48fBVAnYw.text: I had the worse meal of my life tonight. I was yelled at berated and humiliated by a taco man. I told him I wanted two plain meat tacos for my children, I told him several times, the taco man next to him told him several times. When I very nicely said that I wanted them plain he very rudely responded that I never told him and that he was going to treat me however he wanted to, very aggressively. The level of aggression I received from this taco man by the name of Alex (Alejandro) Is like I haven't experienced before. I tried to complain to the manager before I left because he ruined my meal, and I was told he was the manager. I asked to speak to the owner and was told he rarely visits. I am writing this review so the owner is aware of the poor level of service that is offered at his establishment. Honestly the tacos aren't worth the lack of customer service.

U6hLBvg6TVwyxtkN3faCcg.text: Jose is a boss with the margaritas and enhances our experience here at Taco y Taco :)  I will always sit at the bar when he's here no matter what.

71fRQYcK__XZervhMYBe7g.text: My favorite place of all !!! The best Al Pastor in town, all food is fresh and delicious and big selection of salsa bar !!!

h3xO3x4lU42m9atv_VoqOg.text: Amazing fresh food and great tequila selection! Their gran tacos are out of this world and huge. If you're looking for a quick bite or want to impress, Taco y Taco is by far one of the best Mexican eateries in town!

pkzStrXWE1EWGWmmLr54rg.text: My boyfriend took me about two year ago for my first time  and I gotta say it's one of my favorite tacos place to eat . We continue to eat there and I always get the Al pastor tacos without pineapple( not a fan pineapple on the tacos )  it's a lot of people when it on weekend but good to go on the weekdays!

kz3PWQcthwYEKR1-h4h3EA.text: We came here at a busy dinner time on a Tuesday, but with plenty of seating thankfully we were able to find somewhere to sit. The set up is kind of like a food court where you form a line at the area where you'd like to purchase whatever you're craving. These sections are split by meat and then you can choose whether you want it in a taco or other when you get to the front. As the lines get long at peak time, this is not particularly convenient for individuals as you line up a while for one thing, then for another and before you know it, you're good is cold and it's 15 mins later. Thankfully as I was with my partner, he took one line and I took another. I'd definitely split up because unlike a buffet, there aren't as many sections, so you just have to wait and it gets pretty saturated with people in the same area. Drinks are another line so you do this in parts, but the bar area is in the same area where you pay and where you can get sides, such as elote. The food itself is very good. Great flavours, good amount of meat and the elote is large and fresh. The music is also really fun and adds to a great vibe. Staff are friendly at the tills but they don't come around often enough to clear areas from the previous diners. If it wasn't for the food, I'd give this place 3 stars but if you're looking for some good tacos and music in a casual dining space, give it a go!

7P4aCSsjuK1bB7y6YWYdAA.text: This place is basically like a higher end Tacos El Gordo. Super tastey food, nice selection of things you can add to your tacos in the center of the restaurant, and everything! The best part? No long lines, tons of seating, and (for whatever reason) less than half the amount of people that fill up Tacos El Gordo at night.   This place is a far from me, so I won't be able to come here often, but whenever I'm in the area and hungry for tacos, this will be my place to go to!

2n4F-yCu_5Qph7H0mWsytA.text: Ok, so if you've to Mexico and enjoyed authentic street tacos, you'll love this place!  The flavors are excellent, authentic, and delicious!  The only negative that I have is the flow of the restaurant and ordering.  I ended up getting my food about ten minutes before the rest of our party, so that was a bummer.  Not sure how to go about streamlining the flow of ordering, etc., but if it were better, I'd give Taco Y Taco five stars.

UVO8f9dSQV3WGW9SFL0EaA.text: Amazing food! If you are new to this restaurant you may be a little confused on how to order your food. I am lucky that I had my sister there for the first time to tell me how to order. The atmosphere is very nice as well. There is even a place for live music. I haven't been there during the live music, but I'm sure it would be fun.

-qGyH-AG2ShhcYWQYVd7jA.text: Tacos are undeniably delicious. Don't forget to try their loaded nachos as well. The concept of this restaurant is perfect for a quick casual dinner. You walk up essentially as if its a food truck and order your food. There are so many options-its truly hard to decide which one to order. They make it as you order. It's ready in like a minute.   They have a salsa bar in the middle of the restaurant. I noticed they seem to run out of salsa containers fast. Pro tip: use the free water cup for some salsa if they run out of containers.   There is plenty of seating in the restaurant--they also have some seating upstairs. I wish they would add lighting to some parts of the restaurant though because its a bit dark in some areas. But otherwise, taco y taco always has delicious food, a fun atmosphere and decent prices.

uByzWfRpHyDWgXHv5AXmxw.text: Takeaways here:  Tacos are great, Exceptionally worthy Is the al pastor.  We ordered a variety sampler, Barbacoa, pupil, asado, alpastor, bowl, taco, gran taco, corn.  The only thing that stood out is the al pastor taco because it had pineapples and cheese which gave it a sweet salty flavor. The other meats and tacos taste relatively similar especially the marinated ones.  They put similar toppings so it's hard to distinguish.  The asado meat had a good texture next to the al pastor. But it was all very tasty and good.  Final thoughts, there could be some improvements and it would be a 5 star. - weird system, slow, inefficient.  Got 50% of our order wrong and to be honest I can't tell if any of the orders was actually right or what was supposed to be in it.  The people behind the counter just basically put on whatever they liked.   - food got cold by the time I went through the harrowing line system -dirty looking.   With the stations behind and the cooking vats things looked quite disorganized and questionable cleanliness. - not many people cleaning the tables.  Goods - packed even at 4pm on a Saturday, a non prime time -the atmosphere is really likeable.  Nice colors, open airyness, nice Spanish music.  Reminds of a cool place to hang out and have some beers with friends  That's about it.  I would come back for the atmosphere and al pastor taco.  Would give it a higher rating if they somehow fix the food system.  Final note:  yes it feels a bit pricy, but this is prime real estate on eastern, rent isn't cheap either.

yGZnS5Ex1WFhS4DEm-_qKw.text: Love.. Love.. Love.. this place!!!  If you've never experienced this Taco y Taco, you're missing out. First, let me start that it can get a little crowded, and busy, because many locals love it.  So if you're in a super hurry or expect to be in and out in a quickness, you might want to avoid it.   Other than that, I have nothing but great things to say about Taco Y Taco!  Their food is great, the drinks are amazing, the place is super clean, and the overall atmosphere is very fun and chill.   You have to check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

kLIiuZq_85L0NCDAVTlULQ.text: Overall: If you want to go to a Mexican eatery that is good but slightly more upscale, this is the place to go. It keeps the vibe of places like Tacos El Gordo, but the decor is way nicer and is closer to a bar than a taco stand.  Food: 4  Quesadilla: Their quesadillas are decent sized and stuffed with cheese and meat. They will usually ask if you wan guacamole and sour cream inside the quesadilla, but sometimes they forget and you have to ask. I've tried it with cabeza, carne asada, and shrimp, and my all time favorite is probably the shrimp. I'm not a big fan of shrimp, so that says a lot.  Tacos: My favorites are the carne asada, cabeza, and lengua. Their carne asada is good but pretty standard. The cabeza is fatty and juice, and the lengua is pretty well cooked.  Carne Asada Fries: Tasty but not much better than any typical Mexican eatery. In fact, I feel like the carne asada put in these fries isn't as tasty as other places.  In my opinion, it's not really worth it to pay for me the vampiro or mulita but it's up to you.  Service: 3.5  The workers are pretty nice, but the guys making the taco can get a bit of an attitude if you ask for things on flour tortilla. In fact, sometimes they will just tell you that they don't have anymore, even if you can find them at a different meat station. I get that it interrupts their workflow since they don't usually have them on hand, but I think that's something that should be fixed.  Ambiance: 4  Taco y Taco almost has the decor of an upscale Mexican cantina. There's plenty of space to sit on the two level restaurant, and there are even some seats at the bar if you want a drink with your tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp Quesadilla and Tacos de Carne Asada, Cabeza, Lengua
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Quesadilla, Carne Asada Fries, Carne Asada &amp; Cabeza Tacos
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Quesadilla and Tacos de Carne Asada, Cabeza, al Pastor

uVIoD2-8dmKi03HYWRYaMQ.text: I used to like this place. But I have to be honest I will stand in line and the person in front of me will get cut an extreme amount of el pastor  and when it comes to my turn my taco is half of what the person in front of me got. I can understand if the portions are getting skimpier then it should be that way for every customer I feel like certain people get special treatment and that's all I'm gonna say. We used Go multiple times a week but that has changed along with their service.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Lots of tortilla and pineapple. Few meats.

PHpIh7e6xeg7-aIpXyRmFg.text: This is my second time here and I think last time was better. Very affordable!!!!  My mulas was really greasy and couldn't finish it. He was at the end of the meat from the pastor so I got burnt meat that he was scrapping from the bottom. Its quite warm inside even away from the kitchen. They are about to do maintenance so wont commotion the floor I tripped on by the bar of goodies you can add to your food. I love the street corn here but not so much the tacos. I'm not going lower than a 4 since they were better the last time I came. I hope to see improvement next time, I come cause tripping on the floor is not safe. The rug trying to cover it didn't help.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Mulas Pastor.
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Street corn

kdvUUxtfrhWu0yNviWcZXg.text: Freaking great Baja taco joint. I like their 4-line ordering system, and I like even more that they hold their patrons accountable when someone tries to jump in a shorter line and then order something from a more popular station.  We first stopped by for a light dinner before heading into town. I had the lengua and the cabeza tacos, both of which were incredibly tender and flavorful. I also got to sample the al pastor, and that was excellent as well. The tortillas were sturdy and had a discernible corn flavor, and the avocado crema (available at the large station of sauces) was absolutely delicious. My friends got me hooked on the mulas ($4), or filling sandwiched with cheese between two soft tacos, but the tacos ($2.25) are great too. I've had better vampiros ($4) elsewhere - the oil tasted a bit stale to me, but I'm also very sensitive to that sort of thing.   Anyways, I enjoyed dinner so much the first night, I made my friends take me back a second time, and it was just as great as my first experience.  I will say the 4-line system works better if you come as a group so everyone can divide and conquer. Especially when they're busy, it can take a very long time to move through the line so it's really not worth it for one person to stand in two lines. That being said, the taqueros are incredibly efficient and each order is made just about as fast as is humanly possible. Come hungry and come with friends - you're in for a treat.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Lengua and cabeza tacos ($2.25/ea)
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al pastor mulas! ($4)

LSm9E3Ior8sx-SASL0YCYQ.text: This place was amazing. Great authentic Mexican street tacos. The carne asada and pollo were both phenomenal. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for good street tacos. They also have burritos and other food as well.

-A2csatTahAyDZYY1ftcpg.text: This place has been my go to whenever I crave tacos, but it's not always consistent. It really depends because their staff changes and service and taste depends on that person. I've gotten a guy who was moving at the pace of a snail a couple of times.   Some days I get the most amazing Al Pastor ever! Cooked to perfection with nice char and amazing flavor, and a couple times there's no char or caramelization and it just ruins it.  I am a huge fan of their tacos de tripas (intestines)!! I ask for them to make it crispy and it's literally heavenly! I like different textures so I order a vampiro de Asada to complete my order. The crunch, cheese, asada flavor, and fresh guacamole is out of this world!   They have lots of beverages to choose from. Horchata is my go to, but sometimes I feel like getting a little wild so I order a michelada.   Overall, I'll always be a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Vampiro de asada
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Tripas!
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al pastor

vN1JP5HGW_ptkpwe8RwNXQ.text: Garbage, absolute garage! For those of you who say this place has amazing food, your taste buds are flawed. They USED to have amazing food, but not anymore.   I ordered 5 al pastor tacos. However, by the second taco, there was already a large grease puddle on my plate. I couldn't eat anymore of it knowing I was consuming all that fat. I didn't even want to give it to my son, so all he ate while we were there was the Cheerios I had packed in my bag. The meat was flavorless and boring. And the pineapple on top of the tortillas wasn't even ripe yet. Note to the customers, this is not what real street tacos taste like.   The place was a mess when we showed up. There was trash and food all over the floor, the salsa bar was a mess and the garbage bins were so full. There was a young man going around cleaning everything, but the place was getting messy faster than he could clean. Maybe an extra person cleaning would be beneficial to keeping the place up.   And what the heck happened to the salsa bar? The radishes were old and brown? And who's bright idea was it to use the mandolin to cut them with a zig zag blade? They were soggy and thin. I hate wasting food but I threw out a whole bowl of the radishes because they were just gross. And the avocado salsa I used to love so much tasted like straight mayonnaise.   What happened to you Taco Y Taco? You used to be so good. You have lost a customer for life.

Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Specialty cocktails

sO6Dqvbt4XI9yzsvnMkXeA.text: This place was great when we first started coming, last few visits have been disappointing.   The food has lost their flavor, it's kinda like they cheapened their ingredients. I ordered a chorizo mula and it was so greasy that I kept wasting napkins dabbing the grease off.  They need to come up with a better way to order, those lines can get confusing and people will jump in front of you.   I really don't see us coming back, maybe the other location would be better, but who knows

yliaAXJVutSrHf9_jZquJQ.text: Wanted tacos and this place came up on YELP. When we first walked in we though wow this is legit then we noticed the sauce and got super excited haha. Went over to place an order and we got Al pastor and carne asada tacos. Al pastor looked good as it was hanging but I think they gave us ehh dry part that sat there for a while so it was a bit hard. The crane asada taco was ok- the meat tasted a bit gamy for some reason. All the sauces made up for it though.   Over all, this is a Hardcore taco place, like the type you'd find in Mexico. I thought it was have tasted better but it was ok. Not the best tacos I've ever had.   The restaurant is a bit dirty and messy with napkins on the floor. The bathroom however, was very clean! Getting the code for the bathroom was another thing hah

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Sauce bar
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. They put pineapple in the al pastor - very unique I thought
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. THE tacos

R1nhowN8XWXIveh7_iyfdw.text: If we're being honest, I'm not sure why this place is rated so highly. First off, the multiple lines you have to wait in to get different types of tacos or sides is confusing AF. Second off, you end up waiting in multiple lines. MULTIPLE LINES. You want a side? That's one line? Tacos from different taco lines? Other lines. Paying? ANOTHER LINE.   Then the food was mediocre at best. The meat was tough and not super flavorful. Portions were decently sized for the price. The chips and salsa were honestly the best part of my meal. I got 2 tacos, chips & salsa, and a Jarritos soda. After waiting in multiple lines, it probably didn't help my feelings toward the food either.   The service was decent, but due to the way the lines are set up, talking to the people cutting the meat & making the tacos... I could barely hear them. I had to ask the guy to repeat himself 3x because it was damn near impossible to hear over the other lines + the noise of the restaurant.   The decor is nice and there is a good amount of seating, but that was really the best part of this place. I don't think I'll be returning. It wasn't worth the headache of standing in lines on lines on lines for mediocre at best food.

Bb11vbG8y0znlBHepzAPsQ.text: Gross, and messy, my opinion of pineapple on tacos is as negative as pineapple on pizza. Other than that my negatives are the rude treatment when I mentioned that pineapple wasn't on the ingredient list, crazy deferent kind a place a step up from Taco Bell a step down from de taco

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Little unkept
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Sorry

A8AkcIKu_X-r4VJUYSwpJA.text: I was excited to hear we would be coming here for a work outing since I LOVE TACOS! I was truly disappointed with the quality of food here. It was unbearably salty.. I couldn't even finish my tacos (And I'm even one for salty foods). Other than that, the food was bland.   The set up in this restaurant is weird. They have lanes for the different type of food you'd like to order but when there are many groups of people you can hardly tell the lines apart from each other.   I also had to stand around for at least 10 minutes or so to receive my drink. Then to find out all their glasses were used or dirty so I ended up having to drink my Margarita out of a plastic solo cup. Overall, I just wasn't impressed with this place.

GCslcxzyo7KikKknLgfCQQ.text: It was aight Tacos Al Pastor.  --  I really didn't expect this location to have so much space for seating! It looked like there was seating upstairs, too. This place was packed on a Sunday evening.  We were either super hungry since we just went swimming at the lake or the tacos were really good but inhaled it in less than a minute. LOL Jk the tacos were alright. The al pastor looked like it was already pre-carved and the meat's consistency and moisture was near that of beef jerky. The sauce they put on it and pineapple, I guess makes up for the dryness.   Otherwise, the bathrooms were pretty clean and the service was quick.  I would come back if I was starving on this side of town again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Tacos Al Pastor

YqdNLJs0s3P_YcSEDVrdBA.text: Now, I'm a big fan of Baja. My favorite past time is exploring all the taco spots.   Taco y Taco has become one of my go-to's when I am home. I always go for Carne Asada, Carnitas, and the Barbacoa with the habanero sauce.   A lot of people go for the Al Pastor but it really isn't my favorite meat. If you're in a drinking mood, make sure to get their homemade Michelada with their Taco y Taco lager which comes from my favorite local brewery Joseph James.   I'm drooling just trying to figure out when I can get back next!

oRsjPzZ0vuLtmcuZXT8oIQ.text: The service here is so hit and miss!! The guys that make the tacos are either super overly flirty OR super rude and dismissive.  The cashiers are either super rude or in a bad mood. Low in manners and anticipating needs.  I wish the staff had a little more professional training in service and guest retention.  Food is ok. Still overpriced for what you get.

fdmnl4N65_n7K2Zhb1qq1g.text: If you like disorganized dirty chaos this is your place. Placing an order for food is the strangest set up. First you have to get in the right "line" or get barked at by the staff asking "what meat"? It's a mess. No one is there to help navigate you through their odd system.  The food was mediocre at best. Meats were overtly salty, guac was more onion versus avocado, it all didn't taste fresh.  I should have started with visiting the ladies room first and I would have left immediately. Not only did it have a strong odor of backed up sewage, it was filthy. I decided not to even go in the stall, it was that bad. I washed my hands and wedged my foot in the door to not touch it while leaving. Grosssssssss!

raHv1ubbAj1Z1GbWGlU7rA.text: Ordering our meal was a little confusing but overall loved it!!! The vibe was cool and the food was good. I would definitely recommend abs try to come back for a happy hour

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

uFHe6YYBm9lfgShhkSQVJg.text: Some of the best street mexican food ever. Street style corn and pastor vampiro tacos are legit!

FyIEs_CryrOtflgcZvd5Tg.text: Best tacos in town! Definitely recommend this place for authentic Mexican food and great customer service.

CFtBEe4Dufie_f9uYCklBA.text: Loved it!!! Try the pork tacos with everything  even the pineapple. Trust me. It's amazing!! :) get your booty down there!!! The 2 times I went there the place was popping and the music was way way up!! Wish there was coupons or special deals could have been a few dollars cheaper. But I am happy I went! Super yummy!!

ZvqVUlyb2IAHcdEv9C1J9A.text: I really enjoyed the food and the experience. At first it is a little confusing as to how to order but once you figure it all out it is all well worth it. The price was not great but the great food and the unique atmosphere made up for that.

mneh-dICt20imBbdhLPLkw.text: Great hang out for friends or large groups. Authentic Mexican food. I had a carne asada burrito with everything except rice, so delicious. The meat was grilled and not boiled like many other Mexican fast food places. I will be coming here again soon. The jimica was fresh and not watered down either. A must try new restaurant!!!

aUteiwOZEtpp5lKjCcT1ZA.text: Great food. Menu can be a little confussing for us amateurs.  Love the radishes and great setting.  No worries, just ask those around you about their favorites.

mDkNWo8G_J7moJ-bh4UNpw.text: Awesome place to try out! I was slightly overwhelmed when I walked in because of the cafeteria style line, but next one will be prepared. I had the muleta, vampiro, street corn, and chips and guac and they were all excellent! I was surprised by the format in this building because I had been to republics which it was previously. It ended up being a great change of pace and the food was great. A fun group outing as well.

KCb-zal20H1cKUFxxCiH4Q.text: Tacos and corn and horchata oh my! Seriously some of the best tacos I've had in Vegas. From traditional tacos like lengua to the more mellow kinds for those of us who aren't that adventurous like asada. Extremely friendly staff who's definitely willing to let you taste test if you just aren't sure. Sometime there's a little slacking when it comes to refilling the drink machines or the salsa bar but overall everything seems in order.

EPenLf5Ma7fY9zZlhjRGdw.text: You must trust me when I say. Sit at the bar. Relax. Order a cocktail with 2 al pastor vampiros with everything. All I can say is.,.... Your welcome.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. My wife&#39;s whiskey sour. The time and dedication it took to make it! Awesome.

WhDFq0Z6-jQkGZ-EQkpN_Q.text: This is my favorite taco place.  This place could be a little confusing for first-timers.  There are several lines that you can order food from.  The menu is above the line you would wait to order your food.  The Al Pastor tacos are awesome!!! Order it with everything!!! It's the last line on the right-hand side. They cut the meat right from the rotisserie.  It's pork if you're wondering what it is. I'm not a huge pork eater but I promise you it'll be the best thing ever eaten.

_Na8Iz_hXK1qCmNaQhV_uA.text: Food is great, the ordering is pretty simple the only thing that bothered me was the lady working at the bowl and burrito station shortly after ordering she mentioned something about tipping then she scooted the tip jar closer to me! Me working in the food and beverage industry would never do that, made me feel uncomfortable and awkward.

zzUHxIz0J7XbscHzHFqL_Q.text: Great tacos at around $2 apiece, friendly staff, and a pretty impressive rotating beer selection for a taco joint! Everyone in here is always very nice. The only complaint might be that they're a bit of a one trick pony without much variety to their menu, but they're good at what they do and always pretty busy, so don't mess up a good thing, right? Open till 2am on the weekends which might save you from making a mistake at a place like Roberto's. Fill your drunk belly up with some tacos and maybe one more beer instead. Tacos al pastor with all the fixings (which includes pineapple) that's where it's at! Yum!

u_gBoKuIIdYs1dNhLE5c8w.text: Very yummy. If you aren't open minded about trying different yet authentic mexican food, this place ain't the place for you. Taco Bell is always down the street for you. Otherwise, the tacos are delicious. They are street tacos. (Ever been to Tacos El Gordo? Yeah their tacos are like that but way fresher and more flavor.) I got the tacos al pastor and lengua which was delicious. They had a cool salsa bar with of course, fresh mild to spicy salsa. I had a drink of their horchata which was also delicious. The only downfall is that I live all the way in Mountain's Edge and it is quite a drive to get here, but it is worth it. I will come back for more!

cyjZr6Y5kkqd5msX2cTs3w.text: Tried this for the first time a couple weeks ago and now I am hooked. Best Carne Asada Nachos in town. Very friendly. Great resturant! Highly Recommend!

f1ophs7qinzHKanEmC_Rog.text: This place can be a little intimidating if you've never been. Four different lines and a ton of options. Try the Alpastor taco (amazing) and a vampiro (basically a crunchy quesadilla w/meat). If you get a little lost ask someone for help and they'll happily guide you through the menu and they let you sample any of the meats (if your feeling adventurous).

gGNMSd94K9nfUJBBsTfcNg.text: Best tacos in Henderson. Try the alpastor (marinated pork) tacos. They are the best and make sure to get the Mexican corn. Fair warning on Mondays they have a live mariachi band and it's very loud! And their chips are a little over cooked. Still worth it though!

Uxw5wWvuv_lvswDKjU7Nyg.text: Great al pastor tacos.  Asada and barbacoa are also great.  I eat here every chance I get.

Gs6J_xHNXBqiTkfW0E1knw.text: Ok you won't be disappointed if you check this place out. Best tacos I've had in my life and I eat A LOT of tacos. Cool atmosphere has an upstairs eating area. I am thinking I'll be here a lot since I love around the corner. OMG!!!!

ANWRfajPCYcAD8dLKKSrAw.text: Great spot for lunch and dinner.  The food is good.  I love the mushroom tacos and corn. They have a great salsa bar and cocktails  I have been here many times. Never disappointed

tAzVdVoRhdqWgt0k46iQsw.text: My husband and I went here a few days ago and we were happy with what we ordered. We came in to have a late lunch (2pm) and it was confusing at first to figure out how to order.   There is separate stations to order different type of foods (al pastor station, taco station, etc). Then you eventually end up at the end to pay at the cashier. We ordered Al pastor and chicharones tacos, with mole fries.   The food was good but since we were waiting to go through each station, by the time we paid our food was warm instead of hot. The food was delicious and the ingredients were fresh except we wished the chicharones was crispier. I'm assuming since we came in late the crispiness was gone over all.  There is seating everywhere. I'm not sure if this place has always been Taco Y Taco, but there is 2nd story seating.

CYn9vKW_1v5YI0r9GfORbA.text: Taco Y Taco: because I'm an equal opportunity carnivore and will happily nom down all parts of the cow, not just the "normal" meats.  I may be picky sometimes, but when it comes to meats, I try to be an adventurous eater, particularly when visiting one close friend of mine in Vegas who is like.... Andrew Zimmern status. We had been debating between going to Taco Y Taco or Tacos El Gordo (which I have been to, many years ago) this visit, but Taco Y Taco was the obvious choice when it was decided I needed to try the cabeza tacos.  We arrived around 5:30-6 on a late Friday afternoon and it wasn't busy at all. Lots of reviewers have complained about how confusing and complicated the ordering system is with the three lines, and I do see that when it's busy, but since there were no others in line when we went, it was a breeze. We went to the one line we needed, but while there, the guy making our tacos asked if we wanted anything from either of the other two lines while we were there.  My friend ordered 6 tacos - 3 cabeza (head) and 3 tripas. Get the tripas crispy! It makes it the texture of super light, crispy fried chicken skin! Normally, when found in pho or at Korean bbq, i hate tripe, but my friend had be try a piece and crispy in these tacos, I loved it.  I got 3 tacos for myself - cabeza, suadero (meat from between the cow's belly and leg) and lengua (tongue).  The cabeza was great, but the pieces of meat were shredded so, so tiny, it was hard to get a real meaty flavor amidst the onions and cliantro in the taco. This was the one meat that I added some salsa to, but it complimented it perfectly. SIDEBAR: the salsa bar is huge! I'm a big baby for spicy stuff so I only tried one mild salsa, the chunkiest one on the end closest to the taco lines) and it was really great with the cabeza. I also didn't want to get much salsa since I wanted to really just savor the flavor of the meats I was eating.  I had never had nor tried suadero before walking into Taco Y Taco. I was curious as to what it was, and upon seeing where in the cow it was from, I knew I had to try it. I love fish bellies and pork belly, why wouidn't I like cow belly? It was tender and sweet and flavorful. I could have easily had a few suadero tacos. No salsa necessary.  Lengua, sweet, sweet lengua, meat of my dreams. Beef tongue is one of my favorite meats at any Korean bbq (when it's available) and lengua tacos are probably my favorite street tacos. Lengua is such a smooth, melt in your mouth meat that I just want to feed it to all my friends (without telling them what it is first so that they aren't scared). Next time I'm here I'll get at least 3 of these :)  I can't wait to come back to Taco Y Taco the next time I'm in Vegas!

MK-AXThHBLJzqGUlUCsChA.text: Wow I don't know what was wrong with this visit... in the past the tacos were good but this time I had a chicken burrito & it tasted like a salt bath... Taco Y Taco needs to cut down on the salt

Czp2yNKpcmrRCuknC2OcKg.text: This place is my go to for quality Mexican tacos! I recommend this place to everyone! My husband and I have LUNCH dates here! we love how big the place is & it's never crowded or too loud like other restaurants! You walk in and get in the line you'd like to order from. Each line has different meats all fresh off the grill cut & chopped before your eyes! Tortillas are fresh & hand made! If you don't want soft tortillas they have tostadas instead! Their is a build your own burrito/nacho/salad station and street style corn!

d2Hlbc7x_eApB3Vr9NqH6A.text: AMAZING!!! This is exactly the type of taco shop I have been searching for. Moving from San Diego where there is an abundance of delicious Authentic Mexican food, to Vegas where the authenticity seems sparse, I was thrilled to find a nice place to call my new go to Mexican food restaurant.
