3Ypf4JNgb67gtc7094igmA.text: Vegetarian soyrizo is the way to go.  Also a fully loaded elote.  Good sized space.  It can be noisy.  Vegetarians can skip the lines and go straight to the counter on the left.

pW_l9__uJWZ4ebefmCMVVg.text: I used to love this place! But it's not what it used to be. The pastor tacos used to be shaved right off the hunk of meat nice and thin. Tonight they scooped up a bunch of chunks that were already cut off. The corn used to be amazing. Now it's just water logged and dried out. I used to love this place but no longer do. There were also multiple dirty tables and the napkin dispenser was dirty and grimy. They forgot where they came from and need to get back to their roots.

RIIe-5y0Dr-HjKnjqW6vjg.text: Dang, what happened to this place? I feel like the place has aged a lot since our last visit. So much duct tape In the booth seats. We came to eat a late dinner when we got to Vegas our first night. Thankfully the place was empty, so there weren't crazy, wayward lines of people to fight off to get to the counter, lol. The guy making quesadillas, burritos, and street corn was the nicest and most helpful. Sadly the street corn and horchata was just alright, nothing special like I remembered.

a5MPoDx1B5d1-XI9HCCjAQ.text: Sooooo good!! Vampiro tacos are bomb. Love tells fish , shrimp and vegan option. So so good.

qgfN2OY5ndNGgHV-U2ALaw.text: Great set up and more importantly good tacos. I thought the carne asada was weaker than the al pastor but it was good all around. I liked that there was ample sitting as well. Clean and friendly staff to boot. Would definitely come again when in the area.

MXoB1vWBWDS_z0gvmFN4sA.text: Highly recommend. We love all the different taco and options they offer. Food tastes delicious, no long wait times despite the line you see. Their just popular. It could be updated a bit but it's a nice atmosphere. Good music, good drinks and friendly staff.

_nGxe4Pymb28YW3zq1leFA.text: Just moved to Vegas and have always wanted to have tacos like they do in Mexico. These tacos are identical to the ones you get in Mexico. Can't wait to go again and again. I highly suggest you give them a try. You won't be disappointed. ;)

vbTivRO0nisqiFEokgRtOw.text: The pinto beans and grilled onions on the salsa bar are excellent! I had the sofritas bowl.  Very good.   Not as good as Chipotle sofritas, but still very good!

LNn7P63J30jmfsFhEVsXZw.text: My final update for this place. Weakness for tacos brought me here once again. Mistake....I could not eat the atrocity they called a steak casadilla. When I asked for a refund of the item, they would not. Asked for the manager, he swore the food was made right. Asked for the owner, no call back. What a hassle when they make a mistake. Eat here at your own risk. Thank you, manager Tony M!

pXSleqTERBfrLgKu4WKmkg.text: The best tacos I've ever had!! Such unique/authentic flavors. My new favorite spot! Also, my margarita was on point!

wfEobKOOaKabRB4dUB5-KQ.text: It's like a less organized Chipotle, but with better food. Loved the al pastor! I got mine in a bowl, but next time I'll probably get it in tacos. Lots of options, but the ordering was a little googly.

uvDIWDlsqmDpZLbeCgXRlA.text: Central California born and raised & I love this place - authentic, clean, &. Pure eating! The margaritas are excellent as well! Get a vampiro- skip the chicharrones. & eat eat eat.

bvqOYpfhhYOPzohPcZeanA.text: Came here tonight with some girlfriends and loved it.  I am a huge fan of El Pastor tacos!  I usually drive all the way to the other side of town for tacos el gordo.  I'm so happy this place is like 10 min from my house and is so much better!  They have more food variety - You can make bowls, burritos, street corn.... They have a huge full bar - the horchata rum drink and their house margarita were very tasty!  Their interior is super clean and chic decor.  This is not a little taco shop. Weekend evenings they have a DJ Upfront which we enjoyed while having our delicious drinks and chatting up over some tacos!  Great little spots I will be bringing all my clients for lunch

3j5ddCts1TdJT7aUKav_5g.text: The best thing in this place is the salsa bar, but as I was leaving I saw an employee spraying Windex all over the glass of the salsa bar while the salsa was still under it. I'm not sure I want to be eating salsa flavored with Windex.  The food is ok, not great, but the tacos are way over priced.  The worst part was what appeared to be the owners and their daughters (who are obviously working there) arguing in Spanish five feet from my table. I am a white guy that they were not aware is fluent in Spanish. Based on the conversation and what was being said in front of guests, I will NOT go back to this place. They need to remember that they need people of all races to spend money in there restaurant for it to survive. They will not get my had earned money.

v4PMO7CULcEP9IVLZW6oKg.text: Yummmmm best michelada/ red beer in town! Happy hour menu rocks! And as a basic white girl, it's nice to be able to communicate what I want with the waiter lol two thumbs up!

zJZpF8LHPvNQL2J_-XQ8-w.text: My friends like this place i do not.  The ordering system is jacked up and confusing.  The mariachi band waaaay too loud.  Price too high for what you get. Tacos have pretty good taste though. Street corn is yummy too.  I just don't like the experience there.

XX6YBvIdLiiY4bHWuA0qzw.text: This is a beautiful location in a great central area,however my experiences here have not been positive at all. Today was the 3rd time in a week I have came here for Elotes,not a very hard menu item at all to have available throughout the day. The first time I came at around 7pm and was told they've been out for awhile. This EXCUSE was just that an excuse. To cook whole corn takes. It a few minutes and is an extremely simple task that even the most novice cook can do. The second time was just the next day at around Noon and then I was told that they hadn't prepared the corn yet and it would be awhile before it was ready and that I could go to another of their locations. This was both rude and horrible customer service at the same time. The third time was just a matter of minutes ago. This morning I went in at 10:16 pm. I thought to myself that they possibly may not have it ready since they only opened at 10am,but I obviously was wrong in assuming that this establishment was staffed by proper chefs/cooks/or managers who were skilled and knowledgeable in food prep and having the entire menu ready before the establishment opens. Instead of being told this morning that they were out I was instead told "The night shift didn't leave us any prepared corn" so am I correct in assuming that if cooked food weather it be corn in this case or let's say meat of some sort of not used the day before is re-used again the next day?. If so then I really would question the food safety.

ATAv6kJ_FJ6OTLhD5JftlQ.text: Decent place for variety of tacos. Little contemporary/hipster interior.  I like it in general for casual tacos.

8RwGpsl3PytjEkPGn9OEzA.text: I hated the experience. It is chaotic. There is no organization and you stand there trying to figure out where to go and where to pay. The food was ok at best and I don't understand the people who rave about it. If you want to feel panic go eat there.

jwp3Aw8W9sXY4zWbO_NDsg.text: Ordering process confusing, staff less than friendly(exception being the cashier), luke warm, and in my option a little on the pricy side. I had just watched what looked like amazing nachos being constructed for the guy in front of me in line so I expected the almost $9 burrito I was about to order would be stuffed with ingredients but instead I watched as thin layers of components were added. Burrito was not even served to me hot enough for the cheese to melt inside; left me wondering why they bother to wrap it in foil then serve it to you on a styrofoam plate. At the soda machine I was interjected by a fellow diner who told me there's better spots to try on the east side of town.

SP3lS2pnFAYCDO_I0M1Csw.text: This place was recommended by someone at my doctor's office. They said they had some of the best tacos in town and she was right! Love the pork tacos on the spit. Also had great carne asada tacos as well as many other great choices! Ambience is very different than any traditional Mexican restaurant as it has a modern feel and look to it. Highly recommend it!

XSYNsNzJOJWgguAvH6QUdQ.text: Over priced not the best tacos and they charged $2.00 to cut a corn in half. But I guess that's what you get for getting tacos in Silverado Ranch.

R4KfSUclCqBugZDZd0CmHA.text: Ah so delicious. If you're looking for street tacos in a modern vibe restaurant- come here! We just moved here and went three times in the first two weeks we were there. Everything was delicious. I normally only eat chicken but the pastor was amazing.. Also- the Mexican corn was so delicious!

Kvi8Dfr-tSV_V4RB-cnzwQ.text: I love it here. If you know what to order and how to order (which I think is the MOST important) then you're in good shape. I've had their al pastor nachos, carne asada burrito, street corn, and their breakfast chorizo burrito. I love their salsa bar as well as the fact that it has both black and pinto beans at no additional charge. No, the workers are not the friendliest, but if you've ever been here during peak times, you'd kind of understand why they don't bother chatting it up, they have tacos to move!

X-Ntqf5nAJfrcbGc5iKrqw.text: This place would be better if they had more than 4 seats at the bar! They are always taken and I like ordering a couple of tacos at a time and have a few drinks.....not just piling a ton of tacos on my tray and grabbing one beer....then have to go stand in line again if I want more.

8XUp4f9DOKIzVb4RmE2Mgg.text: Great food great atmosphere, whenever I have family or friends visit I bring them here for dinner, lots of seating ( 2 floors ) good lighting and great food tons of options on the menu although I always order a gran taco. I definitely recommend

ix8MuEziUsjkymP8kukX_Q.text: Al pastor tacos are friggin amazing!! Mango chutney is perfect on them. Seriously amazing tacos. The street-style corn on the cob is amazing...add a Modelo and its one of the best lunches out there!   The building is beautiful and the atmosphere is lively.

mrBSh31gLrKpIHidMFnCJw.text: Great location cool atmosphere inside  Definitely a must when in the mood for really good authentic Mexican food...skip chipotle and try this place out. Service was great too! Alpastor was my favorite very unique flavors and not something you can order a lot of places in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

tcSa_yhrAju9P2A7YdT5TA.text: He tacos here are bomb, there's no doubt about it. However it's on the pricier end of things. They even charge more than king taco in California. 4 star because the interior is always dope and relatively clean. They could use a little training on their customer service if they're a brand. Some of the guys working there can be a bit off putting. Kind of like they don't want you there lol. Other than that, the tacos make it worth dealing with their attitude

Eq4eOFgZ7ww58s8DpA07IQ.text: I USED to love Taco Y Taco when they first established, but every time I keep coming, the quality and atmosphere gets worse and worse. :(  I thought I would get used to the ordering process, but it's not organized at all and it frustrates me. It gets confusing when there's a long line for line 1, and you want to order from line 3, but you don't want to cut anybody and make them (h)angry.  Particularly this past Friday night June 12th, 2015, it was hot and smelly inside. The AC wasn't on, and it reeked of garbage and wet dog in the area next to the staircase. It was seriously uncomfortable eating inside, and I regret choosing not to just eat at home.  I ate 2 al pastor tacos (which I usually get) and the al pastor was not juicy like I had remembered. It was overcooked and not flavorful. It's just difficult because I used to be obsessed with their al pastor, and that night I was utterly disappointed (I take my food seriously, especially when I come to LOVE it haha).  Maybe I just came at a bad night. I give them 2 stars instead of 1 because I remember how they used to be. I'm sad that I was actually disappointed with my experience that night.

VRJCeBu8WxH5FTRP1vWnkg.text: I really wanted to love this place since it's close by and had so many good reviews.  The tacos al pastor were good, but unfortunately they got cold while we waited for the shrimp tacos to cook (in hindsight we should have waited for the shrimp tacos to be done before ordering anything else because it took quite a while).  Unfortunately, the chicken in the chicken taco was so burned that half of the serving was essentially inedible charcoal.  The shrimp tacos were good and flavorful and so was the guacamole.  Some other reviews commented on the loud music, but it was fine when we were there.  Overall it was ok but we aren't excited about returning.

U0DdixgdMGd2tQ6Nr5jiJA.text: Love this place  el pastor is amazing !! Staff is awesome  super friendly and fast service

kuOug9HzQBU_aM1CGoDn4w.text: Mexigoodness!!   I love this place. I come here a few times a month and never have a bad meal or a bad experience. The guys behind the counter are always friendly, the food is made to order and whatever you order is always flavorful. Last night I went in and a Mariachi band was playing!! They were awesome!   The Vampiro is one of their specials and is always a good idea. Carnitas and fresh pineapple squished into cheesy fried tortilla goodness.They have tons of vegetarian options including the soyrizo tacos. I always order them with everything on them. Delicious!! I love the Mexican corn which is sweet corn with crema, cotija cheese and chili powder. So good. The salsas are all at a help yourself area and offer a variety of mild, medium and hot choices along with beans, veggies including marinated onions and fresh radish and lime.   I always get the horchata with my meal. By far, the best I have ever had. The sweet cinnamon milky drink helps cool down the spicy flavors of your tacos or burrito. I'm not even embarrassed to admit I usually down three cup fulls.   Try this place out, you'll love it.

A_0rNQOptD132_zBwOg8_g.text: Overall it was not a good experience and we felt we wasted our food and dinner time at this place.  Nothing to write home about.  Over priced. Food not good & it was cold.  Everything was too spicy.  My family did not eat more than two bites of their food. We got Fish tacos, lingua, cabeza tacos and chicken quesadilla.  Menu ordering is not clear.  You have to wait in different lines to get different food items.  By the the time you are getting the second and third item from a different line, your first few items are cold already and you have waited more than you'd normally wait in a line to order your food all at the same time!  The nachos chips were greasy.  For the prices they are charging they're serving the food in paper plates and plasticware?!!  Better mex restaurants out there and less expensive.    Not worth it.

bunWq0j5daNghnBAiEt0Iw.text: Delicious !! My boyfriend and I always make it must to stop in and eat when we are in the area. Never been dissapointed. Our favorites are the al pastor and carnitas, they have a great selection of beers as well!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. ItsTuesday and I was craving Tacos for lunch so I had to drive to the best place in the City! yum!(Disregard the Starbucks cup)

j3rlFTJ--iXoKpLaWenCRQ.text: We got carne asada and pork tacos, and chicken nachos.   Tacos: bomb.  Nachos: meh.  Music: way too loud.

DUSAYCE2Kr6uD_Y5q-X4oA.text: This place had quality tacos and a fun and easygoing atmosphere. We have had a couple large group gatherings here and the staff was very accommodating.  However, seating was limited and we were not informed that there would be an issue. Additionally, the environment was a bit excessively loud and it was not due to our group...  Overall; customer service was great, food was delicious, environment was loud.

ZAEFmqJMaTnfrkiq3Aa83g.text: This place is super cute and the food is really great and full of flavor! There was so much to choose from for a gluten free vegetarian. I wanted to try everything on the menu! Ordering is soooo confusing though. I think without the confusing ordering and changing to a traditional restaurant, this place would be 5-stars easy!   There's also a small space for patio seating, and we liked that for our kids so they wouldn't bug everyone. Haha.

uoFc-0ASQbiFbtpvXMwirQ.text: Real good, authentic Mexican food. Good vibe. I had the carne asada taco and mulas. I'm now a huge fan of mulas. Next time I'll order my drink first because by the time it was made, my food was cold. Still tasted great. I think the lights could be turned down inside just a little to give it a really nice atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Mezcal Mule, Carne Asada Taco and Mulas.

-_UstPyb2Bfcyz2yVVv7GQ.text: My wife and I have enjoyed T Y T before and looked forward to a great lunch.  And everything seemed like it would be good as usual....except everything came out cold.  cold tortillas, luke warm meat and room temperature corn.  Food came from 3 different stations and all failed.  When we arrived no one was ready for our order and the food looked old.  The only good thing was the foods (at least on initial bites), had good flavored...  We should have returned the food or walked out..,,

vc7YU_TI3VitJk4gIkDjww.text: Imagine the best food truck tacos you have ever had and you get Taco Y Taco. I am a frequent customer. It can get busy so I try to go on the off times a little bit. There is another location on Trop, but I like this location a lot more.  They have a wide variety of meats for you tacos along with other dishes like mole nachos and Mexican corn. Tacos are $2-$3 each but they have a happy hour. There is also a bar and occasionally a DJ.   Probably the best praise I can give is that I make sure to bring all my out of town guests here as part of their Las Vegas experience.

DcIMho6ogup8vV8jl5xf3A.text: I love love love Taco Y Taco. My favorite is the vampiro. The carne asada is delicious but I have to say the best thing is the corn. The counter ordering  is a bit awkward but once you've been a few times you get the system down.

fhczBqdnRF9d3OxAKCLfeA.text: Great service. Great food. Unlike other taco places they aren't stingy with the meat. Our go to taco place!

45FbS3rBYcwQyr-nW-rOtg.text: Such a hidden gem in Henderson. A friend recommended this place, glad I came here. Once we entered there was a DJ playing some house music, which went with the vibe of the place, open and very inviting. There are about 3 stations where you order your food. We got 3 chicken tacos and 3 Carne Asada tacos with everything on it! Yummmmmm is all I can say, everything is freshly prepared and made right in front of you! I tried the tacos vampiros for the first time, and let me tell you this is my favorite now! Crunchy, cheesy, delicious explosion of flavors in su boca! I'm definitely coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Carne Asada Tacos
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Carne Asada Vampiro

RNpoXulcwYxdE8n-uWjPyA.text: Loved it!  Went back again... Loved it!!  Too many delicious things to choose from.   The condiment bar is awesome!

gkoJso7PdaK5HIcXSKuirg.text: Some may say that this location is no match for the original. I could agree in some sense. You definitely cannot beat the beer prices over at the original. Yet the new location does have some attributes that are more favorable than the original. One; They have beers on draft. Two; They have liquor. Three: Lines are quick.   My list is going to make it seem like I'm an alcoholic. That is only half True. The real reason why I go to Taco Y Taco is for their food. The al pastor is one of my favorites. They have that charred crisp on the outside that stands up to the slathering of everything. Ask for the grilled pineapple, too. It just makes the meal better. I have tried almost every single taco and I cannot see anything to complain about. The lengua, cabeza, and carnitas are all delicious. If they do not put on everything that you wanted, do not fret, their salsa bar is unreal, too. I'm used to the cold bar being filled with a few varying degrees of spice, radishes, limes, and the pickled veggies. Theirs has a hot section as well. Grilled onions and jalapenos just taste better when they are kept warm for you.  Although I do not mind to drive to the old location. I can rest at ease knowing that this location is a viable solution to my taco needs.

ax3t2Bf-Lo4kDy9MTrBRNg.text: If you're in the mood for some sweet tacos, look no further.  I finally have found a taco joint here in the valley that makes authentic Tacos al Pastor.  They have a decent selection of taco styles but I chose to go with the Al Pastor and the Mexican Street Corn on the Cob.  Needless to say, the food was delicious, and I will definitely be back for another round of amazing.  The only confusing thing is walking in the door you kind of get lost as it is first come first serve seating and the lines have no real direction.  So as soon as you walk in, get to the counter ASAP!  Regardless, this is my new favorite taco spot!  Thanks Taco y Taco, can you start up a Burrito y Burrito?

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexican Street Corn On The Cob. It is as delicious as it sounds!
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Because who doesn&#39;t love chips and guacamole?
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Tacos From Heaven.  I think I had eight of them before entering a slight coma.

Qlgc4Ibrs1a6n9HuirRLpg.text: This was a sad choice for grabbing tacos out with the family. Stood in front of a counter at the "burrito" counter where I was not welcomed, not asked what I'd like but just looked at by 2 employees who decided to stand there and talk to each other and drink. Not being there before I was wondering if I somehow was in the wrong line. Went back over again and this lady asked what I want. I told her 3 burritos. She wanted me to tell her the ingredients of all burritos before she started.... then rolled her eyes because as I'm trying to shout my order at her (music is loud and you can't hear a thing) I'm not going fast enough. As I moved down the line with ingredients she did the same thing. I wanted to tell her to eat the burritos herself for being such a C but my kids were hungry and ready to eat. I could keep going about how dirty the restaurant was and the ladies at the register texting while with a customer with the most welcoming faces.   Never returning. Huge disappointment with all these deceiving reviews.

GKFHd8_FenmOsmmZxmZhGA.text: Pretty cool taco/burrito experience. Seems authentic. Lots of meat, seafood and many vegetarian options too!

wxEmQBF5G3BPrE6B6R92vQ.text: The tacos here are pretty delicious! The place is clean and they have a nice ordering fashion goon on! There's different lines for different types of tacos and they're a tad bit on the expensive side about 2.50/taco but I think it's worth it.   These tacos are like the small street tacos or taco truck sizes. Once you order them, you can walk to a different line to get your toppings like cheese or whatever on it. That line is also for other stuff like nachos, fries or burritos and other stuff. They can definitely hook you up on them fries and nachos! Just a tip, if you want cheese, specify which type because they have like 4 kinda. My husband asked for cheese and they gave him the shredded Kraft Mexican style cheese. I say that because I'm used to getting queso fresco or cojita cheese on my tacos so just be aware :).  Once you're done, they also have a fresh salsa bar as well with a variety of sauces, radishes, limes and fresh veggies like cilantro and onions!!! A do it yourself kinda place is the best place!  All in all, we're coming back for sure because this place is delicious AND it's off the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Michelada with modelo beer
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Dressed up red beer
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Lengua tacos with one al pastor

vUsaItEWK7tqraVmCeib_Q.text: Next time I'll make the trip to Tacos El Gordo.  Not only is this place confusing with the signs saying there are lines, (then they yell at you and tell you to form one line) but the staff is so unfriendly you feel bad for even wanting tacos that day.  To top of off, after being yelled at for being in the Carne Asada line, I go back to the other line only to be told there isn't any Carne Asada when I made it to the front of the line... again.

C4GIydVmj-ScYquRC141zw.text: Love their salsa bar with bean option. Tacos aren't bad just they get cold rather quickly. I can order a carne Asada taco and then want a carnitas taco but the cook has to jump from one station to another to get it for me.  Staffing seems limited ):  Hope they get it together.

GALQz5atjO3bEQ3acKpv0w.text: Tyler Jolley was the best bartender I've ever encountered. He was courteous and very knowledgeable about drink mixology. He handled himself in a busy atmosphere like it was something he does everyday. I recommend everyone come here just to get this great bar experience.

VnWWYCzD2xcFC4gN1AUyyA.text: Yoooooooooo. Okay so tacos el gordo is my love, but my best friend literally raved about this place so of course I had to try. Wow let me sayyyyyy move over tacos el gordo!!! There's an incentive to go here, because there's seafood tacos :)  The only complaint was that their elote was lacking in flavor. Anyway.... Pretty good stuff peeps!! Try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

CpQT4hHycvEvh6zFENfO2g.text: Crazy loud fun unusual authentic taco place of the Gods.  Literally my last Vegas meal before flying home, and walked in to live Mariachi band that were as perfect as you can get.  Little confusing cafeteria style ordering area with different stations for different tacos and sides, they need to setup a flowing single line to make that flow better and eliminate the confusion.  With that said, who can complain about fresh homemade corn tortillas and endless real Mexican meat choices from chicken to beef to pork to fresh garnishes of fresh lettuce onions cilantro etc.  Was sorry was in a rush as I have to go back to try the roasted corn, quesadillas etc.  My al pastor  tacos were delicious as was the amazing salsa bar with endless choices to dress your taco with.  Not the best I have had but pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al Pastor
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Kitchen
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al Pastor

AJu9b5W2lL5Xjt_nq7JLiw.text: Visiting Vegas for a few days and came here on a Sunday around 4pm The place is clean, staff was very friending and the tacos omg amazing. I ordered Carne Asada and tongue tacos and they were so good. ( they come with avocado, onion, and cilantro) The only thing i didn't like about the place was the 3 different lines i had to wait in.. they were very confusing and everyone keep cutting in front of me. The menu is in Spanish so i had to figure out our what each meat meant. ( it would be a good idea to translate next to them)  Other than the confusing lines and the whole menu being in Spanish i love the place and will def come back

ZGtlFCJXGnQ0s5_jj3T63w.text: Great food and wonderful service. I will definitely be back soon!!! One of the best tacos I ever had

BY6jpg967V0fOmGP3Trg-g.text: First things first. This place has some of the best tacos ever. Generally fast service. Amazing heat. Chopped to order meat. Even a gringo menu for those less adventurous. Overall it's a great meal and reasonably priced.   That out of the way, what the actual feck is going on with the bar and the cashiers? Every time I order a beer the ladies at the register look like I'm speaking Mandarin. They ask the bartender. They never key in the right thing. It's a mess. Tonight I read the name of a beer off of the "todays drafts" list and the bartender looked like I asked for his dead puppy. They didn't have that beer. That was listed on the list of today's beers.   I really love the food here. It's seriously a place I bring every visitor. This is my taco happy place. But y'all need to get your stuff together on the cash register and bar side. Make the overall experience as good as the food.

lbuO1F_YzSLIeKcqaghCQg.text: DO NOT GO HERE. THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT DIETARY RESTRICTIONS EVEN IF YOU CHECK MULTIPLE TIMES.  How do I start this. I have gone here a few times with my wife. She can not eat meat and if she does she gets very sick. This place was nice because it had soyrizo so it was a great option. Yesterday I went there to pick up lunch. She is sick so this sounded good so she could get something spicy to help clear her sinuses. When ordering(which I hate because of the lack of proper lines) I ordered hers. I thought they said chorizo so I double, checked that it was soyrizo and not chorizo. I even confirmed making sure it was the vegetarian option. They confirmed it and I placed my order. When I got my order I doubled checked everything was correct and mine said chicken and hers said soyrizo.   I take the food home to her. We start to eat and she notices something that was stringy. She said immediately spits it out and checks but it looks like soyrizo should and I told her I double checked and even saw they get it from another area so it should be good. She takes another bite and spits it out right away again. Right there is a chunk of steak. I open the burrito and look and all through the soyrizo are chucks of meat. I want to be clear this was not a mistake of a wrong protein. This was soyrizo but in whatever way meat got into it. She freaks out and runs to the bathroom to try to get it out of her system. We thought she would be ok but the next few hours she is in pain leading to very being ill and throwing up everything. She was already sick and now she cant hold food down all because they dont care? I do not mean to be graphic and this explains more then it needs to but this is severe. It was bad but could have been much worse. What if it was a life or death allergy?  TL;DR Their vegetarian option had meat in it which made my already sick wife very ill. They do not care about your dietary needs or restrictions.

jYoCdF75d_YUV2pjRrZ0lg.text: Absolutely love this location. I used to frequent the one on the eastside when I worked down there, and this is a huge step up! Though I do love the small "taco truck" feel of the east location, the one in Henderson is great. Huge building, upscale look and feel, and a bar! The lines can get a little confusing if you're new, but just know if you want tacos, stand in the line for the meat that you want. If you want burritos or bowls, stand in the line to the left. Once you get your food, move on to the register. Their jalapenos and onions at the salsa station are to die for, and there are so many salsa options as well. I'm doing low carb, so I got a barbacoa bowl with no rice or beans, but previously loved their Grande Tacos. Two corn tortillas with melted cheese in between, and double meat. Their carne asada fries are pretty massive and loaded as well (though again, low carb... so I didn't touch them lol)

qXQLiHUb_gBQeyYYeDZcgA.text: Taco size is small, and the condiments station is not clean as another reviewer stated. They were out of cups to fill up salsa, and low on many of the salsas.  Guacamole wasn't super flavorful. The staff was very friendly. The cost was decent though per taco, $2.25.

RV9UaJ4TWp2LOLh1icn9hA.text: Before eating less meat, I'd alwaaaays come here for their Al Pastor tacos. They are absolutely amazing, especially with extra pineapples! The carne asada one is good as well, but it is definitely not my favorite. And I also enjoyed the lengua tacos. The meat was flavorful and chewy - but a good kind of chewy!  BUT A WHOLE NEW WORLD FOR MEEEE, I came here because it was a Tuesday, duhhh. And I am dipping my foot into the pescatarian life. I ordered their shrimp taco, fish taco, and soyrizzo. All three of them were with pineapple, guacamole, and cilantro. I really enjoyed the shrimp and fish taco. It came with a good portion of shrimp and fish. The soyrizzo was rather salty, which weren't my favorite.   I also ordered their elote; which I always order! It's not the best imo, but I am always coming back for it :-) I love this place because the bar has a lot of sauces and toppings for free - avocado sauce, salsa verde, three hot sauces, beans, limes, carrots, jalapenos, radish, etc. it is amazing!  Side note: their micheladas are either good or really good lol it's not always consistent. Other than that, I love this place!!

5VwyzeBf92T_QViktVnBow.text: Very disappointed by the number of workers that looked up at me and continued to go about their business. No signage or friendly instruction to place order at wherever they take the order (Still don't know, as I simply left after a family of four came in and looked sheepishly at me as we all waited for a greeting, whatever.   Lots of places in Las Vegas with far fewer, far friendlier staff, who would like to have the business. It's tacos, not rocket science, and lots of friendly places sell them in Henderson too.

jSfmvIzoI8CVVDOYlvy2Ew.text: I love the atmosphere of this location. Parking lot always packed here. On the weekends they have live music so it's a cool place to go have tacos and beers with friends. The salsa bar is my favorite thing about this place. Mexican food is pretty much oily food so if you looking for healthy meal avoid meat and go with corn on Cobb or salad with salsa :) and they're offer seafood such as shrimp and white fish.

0QDGvVcZbGcc2uZMJLqpbw.text: I was really hoping for a "Woohoo! As good as it gets!" experience here because all my Yelper friends are big fans of this establishment. Unfortunately it was just "A-OK."  Coming into the restaurant, I was already intimidated because of the ordering process. After my first time anxiety passing over and giving myself time to read the menu, it was just any other ordinary taqueria ordering process.   My boyfriend and I decided on carne aside and carnitas tacos and al pastor fries to share. The tacos were great; they were tasty and the meats were cooked tenderly. The al pastor fries though, could be better, to be honest. The fries came with guacamole, cheese, pico di gallo, crema and pineapples. The pineapples were actually a disappointment on the plate; I didn't think it paired well with the al pastor fries at all. The fries were also under done (I usually like my fries to be thick and crispy, but these fries with thick and soggy.)  One thing I really like though, is there self serve condiment station filled with goodies. Their hot sauces were great and the condiment bar was fully stocked.  3/5 stars, mainly because the price didn't justify their quality.  \_()_/

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. L: carnitas tacos. R: carne asada tacos.
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al pastor fries and carnitas/carne asada tacos.

bfy4HHYv0pBQ_lEDemutuQ.text: Please, please, please change your ordering process.  And please, please, please change your  ordering signage.  Every time I go there I get so confused and so frustrated that I never want to go back.  Apparently, you must get in line according to the type of meat you want but on the signs, the meat is in small letters. What if I want one chicken taco, one pork taco and one chorizo taco? Do I have to get in line 3 times? Then you must choose one of four types of tacos but there are no descriptions on the signs and no menus to read. What is a Vampiro?  What is mula?  And why are those choices in larger letters then meat choices when the line I choose must be by the meat I want?  The third line is for Al Pastor.  What the heck is Al Pastor?  There is no description on the sign. However there was a large spinning hunk of meat that looked pretty good so I chose that. Then I had to choose my type of taco. Not knowing what any of these taco choices were because there's no description on the sign I pleaded for a menu. All of them were corn tacos or corn tortillas. Because I do not like corn tortillas I asked for a flour tortilla. The employee told me I had to go to the other side of the room to order a flour tortilla even though I was in the right line for the meat I wanted.  With my frustration growing exponentially and my family getting annoyed at all of my questions, I settled for a corn tortilla just to get the ordering process over with and because I didn't want to start all over again and wait in line on the other side of the room.    Although the ingredients tasted great, I hated my corn tortilla! Of course that ruined the whole taco.  Upon reading the five most recent reviews, everyone complained about being confused with the ordering process. Taco y Taco,  please change your ordering process. I don't think I could take another frustrating, annoying experience regardless of how good your food is. Thank you.

dysC47qmIQM_MyxZUwFsiw.text: I ordered two Sopes and one Mexican Corn On The Cob from here through DoorDash, which I usually never get any issues with their food either in store or delivery. Today, I received a burnt to crisp tostada (see pic 1) which doesn't taste pleasant paired with my chorizo Sope. The tostada on my Carne Asada Sope (see pic 2) wasn't as burnt at all, so maybe the person forgot about that particular one and slapped it on there anyway. Might eat here again, just not on Saturdays when that person who burnt the tostada works.   #freethetostadas

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Assad Sope
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Crispy much?

KSXdMqEx7UjDwYJmfH16Ng.text: Wow.. Has this establishment gone down hill since the last time I was here! I'm VERY glad I came alone, instead of bringing my husband for his first visit.  The staff on the grill line were friendly.. It went downhill from there.  The salsa bar was a mess, and many items hadn't been refilled. The beans were completely empty, and I was informed that they no longer put black beans out because, "They're expensive!" Seriously? The radishes were soggy.. as if they had been soaking in water.  The Vampiro wasn't grilled when I ordered it. The shells were premade and hard. The cheese on it seemed as if it had be pre-made as well.  The corn was large, and a decent value.. But, it wasn't sweet as it always had been when my friend and I used to come here often.  A nice gentleman asked if he could clear my tray for me (that was nice!). He asked how everything was, and when I told him the things I mentioned here, he said, "Oh sorry." I asked if the manager was available, and was told, "no." I asked if I could have his card (I intended to call, vs. writing a negative review).. Nope.. no card! Just a hand written phone number for me to use to call the office if I wanted to.  It's sad. I really used to love this place.  I MIGHT try the Tropicana location to see if things there are any better.

_bi6ho4pAz6dhMnbob_umw.text: BEST STREET TACOS IN VEGAS!! So hard to find a bomb street taco place in the desert but this place comes up! So freaking good and lots of meat options and so much flavor!

xfbRumDdWNgdw7nH4ojGzQ.text: Tacos were amazing. We got al pastor, carne asada, & shrimp tacos. The line setup was a little confusing for a first timer however the food service as quick. Would definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Al Pastor Tacos
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al Pastor Tacos

0tepzIXS7GK3cjUch97Q3Q.text: Their tacos were really good. Had the carne asade, carnitas, chicken, and the el pastor. None of them were a disappointment. I wish I could say the same for the street corn but sadly I cannot, it was pretty bland and over cooked. Their line setup is horrible too but the tacos were worth the wait.

IAYN6TPbOh5WpmvO71OIuQ.text: I came to this taco spot on Sunday 5/19 with my friend, we were visiting from LA. Service was okay, meat, not so great. I have never tasted such plain tacos! No flavors whatsoever! Not to mention the salsa, tasted like watered down salsa. The guac, tasted like it was just smashed, also with no flavor. Maybe that's just how they cook with no seasoning?  Other than that, I don't think we'll be eating here again. So if you like flavorless tacos, this is the spot!

nTQc3Bl9AlgqJk7K4FYMXA.text: We recently moved to Vegas from SoCal and were pretty bummed to see that there aren't that many authentic taco places around the southwest area. We love al pastor so of course that's what we wanted to try here. It didn't disappoint. Flavor was on point and they cut the meat right into your tortilla. As for the other meats, we've had better. Carne asada was okay, and the chicken didn't really have flavor. We also tried the chorizo, it was bland but salty. All in all we'd definitely come back for the al pastor. They have happy hour from 3-7 daily too, so that seems to bring a lot of people in. It died down after 7pm. The place is welcoming, music playing, TVs on, and they have a little upstairs dining area too. Cute place to dine in Henderson, but definitely going to continue our search for more authentic Mexican food in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al pastor tacos and chicken tostada. The guacamole is not good. Al pastor is great though.
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

XfCZ7pJGSigDxfHLrkqfYw.text: I am so picky with tacos, I have only one other place in town I eat at for Mexican food. My boyfriend wanted to try this place out, I go to Einstein's all the time so I was curious as well. We went on a weekend so it was pretty crowded. The lady helped us where to go in line. We got a total of 5 tacos (2 chicken and 3 carne asada) and two drinks for $22, little pricey for tacos but honestly was surprised.  They were the best tacos I have had out here. It topped my other place I go to, no joke. They had sooo much flavor and the pico was spicy which I loved. Really good tacos people! Definitely worth it. This place will be my go to when a I crave some tacos. They also have a bar :)

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

UDCeQOk-CmDddefYjMTHfA.text: Can't seem to find anything wrong about this place ! Absolutely love their Gran Tacos!

ncKVRgGo-aioiRGIkHXl_A.text: Great tacos, but there's definitely room for improvement.  The main problem about this restaurant is that there are 4 different lines, but there are no actual lines. As soon as you walk in, it's just a mosh pit of people all standing in a group and there is no organization even though there are supposedly 4 different lines where you can get 4 different things. The entire time we were standing in line all you heard were people yelling "Yeah I have no idea where to go I'm just waiting until I get up there." Also yes, everyone was yelling because it's a popular restaurant, lots of people but they still insist on playing loud music so you have to yell to hear the people who you are talking to. There is more order amongst people at any taco truck you visit but Henderson is apparently afraid of taco trucks.  Now, ALL OF THIS ASIDE, once you actually get the food it is delicious. you can see the different types of meat stewing together as they pull it out of the hot pot. It is tender, it is delicious, it is a little bit pricier as far as tacos go but I've definitely seen worse. The horchata is like horchata syrup; thick and wayyyy too sweet BUT they have a happy hour for the bar so won't complain too much.   Overall, I give 3 stars for the food and drink, take away two stars for the overall atmosphere and disorganization of the restaurant as a whole. I'm sure I'll be back but it'll be on like a Tuesday when hopefully it isn't as packed and chaotic.

iYopSo5lsDSG5qDHgzWZeg.text: It's a little confusing when you enter the restaurant  to find how the ordering process works. We had someone cut us in line at the bowl/burrito ordering station bc the taco lines lead right up to it. I can see their lines getting unorganized during their busy times.   Seating is first come first serve. Order your food at the counter, find a table and retrieve your own drinks and utensils.   As I'm writing this, I am also thinking about how delicious their lengua tacos were and that I may go back again today. I also ordered their bowl with carne asada (guac is extra) and it lived up to my expectations. Best Mexican food I've found in Vegas so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Lengua taco and carne asada bowl with cilantro lime rice, black beans, lettuce, pico, guacamole and sour cream drizzle

_JC1iAn1k94k6Q92Arw21Q.text: I got all 3 street tacos, carne asada (beef) , pollo (chicken) and Al pastor (pork). All three of these tacos were amazing. The people there were really nice and it was our first time, they helped us a lot and even let us sample some of the meat. They had lots of options and the place was very nice. The food is more of an authentic Mexican which is very good. Overall this is a great place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. This is what I got I got a Jarritos fruit punch to drink which is really good and three street tacos. Chicken, beef and pork!

BoWUSYiHirq0lX_KiGTo9Q.text: Talk about great tacos that are prepared right in front of you in a location that is too nice.  Go in their with $10 bucks and have great tacos. Be it carnita, carne Asada, lengua - they can carve your meat in front of you. They have alcohol and TV at this location as well. It is an inexpensive place to have the chance to try many tacos that you are not going to get the same quality of at a Roberto's. You won't spend a fortune. Very solid place.

LW1HSgMkkkqtAkkJ18fryw.text: Couldn't find a good street taco since we're from San Diego and finally found some! A little confusing walking in your first time there especially when there's a lot of people but these tacos are so bomb! We ended up there the next night too! Happy we found a taco place just like home!

hJQFB7ObXw0E_rixHlM-zg.text: This is my go to for Mexican street tacos! The ambiance is great, the food is always good, and the bartender Oscar is the best! They have a variety of meats that aren't offered at other taco places and the service is great

77_d3_d7MPwRcUNUEX-k3Q.text: After a strenuous hike up Black Mtn, there's nothing better than a couple of their tacos and a cold beer. Oh, I'm in heaven! This place is like a cleaned-up version of those taco stand places you see in the barrios. Just be warned, it does get busy at lunch and a little crazy because people (including me) don't seem to know where to stand in line for stuff. ...but their tacos, and their beer, and their little salsa bar... yum!!

OLlNF3N3-LPVRfnGw-X1AQ.text: I just moved offices and finally checked out the fancier version of Taco y Taco! I have to say that the bar and restaurant itself is such a beautiful space. Their salsa bar is also just awesome. It puts all the other salsa bars in town to shame. All of their salads also taste great by the way!  Anyways.. Taco Y Taco is a Mexican restaurant that specializes in tacos. Some of their other dishes are quesadillas, mulas, and fries! I have to say they make some pretty tasty food. Everything is always cooked well and flavorful.  My recommendations are adobada and lengua in any form. They have some of my favorite tongue in the city. Tongue on fried is awesome.  I recommend asking for extra salsa and their grilled green onions. So good!  I still stand by their sub par service and their disorganization. It's just so confusing for their customers. They need to fix that. They'd make more money and have better customer satisfaction.   I'd still give them the okay for some solid tacos.

BWZkY7vvP3zeD9ZCfgmFBA.text: On a short vacation from  northern California .... Heard good things and they definitely delivered! Pastor was bomb , asada was fire and the carnitas juicy and flavorful.... Good salsas and drinks to wash it down .... Great overall experience! We definitely recommend dining here for some good authentic tacos....

QOk4ZjztkrcMp5ZtoU1m2w.text: Rude customer service. They mess up your order and expect you to pay for it. You ain't getting a cent of my money with a service like that.

5SwyLUl_5tPDIwSDjLwvdw.text: Hands down our favorite taco joint, even if we have to drive across down for it. The way you line up to order is intimidating at first, but then you get the hang of it. I've directed my fair share of random newcomers that come in the door.

sRz5Ry2VEet05DHJH8kAZw.text: There were so much things go in on in this taco place at the time we got here around 4:30 on the weekend. It is a self serve place with a small bar to serve alcohol. We ordered food by getting in the line that has the type of meat we want for. They have different type of unique meat to serve. I could customize my taco with corn or flour tortillas & followed to line to pay at cashier. Wherever available we can pick a seat there but it didn't make the place go messy. Every table was cleaned up & be ready for us at this good point. I love hot sauce & I was so happy to have my habanero salsa as self serve cold island booth. There is nothing to complain about the food

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

L0nWZswJCE2DEEI6SZmYBg.text: First, and last time here! The line system is ridiculous. We ordered our tacos and then had to wait another 15 minutes in a separate line to get chips and salsa and sodas. By the time we got all of our food and sat at a table, the food was ice cold. The guac was mostly fuller with very little avocado.

-MlCso86DVp-_-TFdknBVA.text: My coworkers and I placed an order today and we ordered multiple items and it was messed up. We specifically put in the notes for door dash what we want and don't want on our food. I ordered a taco al pastor, meat only. It came with pineapple cilantro and onion. I couldn't eat it because I am allergic to pineapple. We also ordered corn on the cob and there was only cheese on it. The picture shows way more than just cheese. I am very please with door dash delivery but displeased by the messed up orders. The gran taco came with black beans when I ordered pinto beans. The shrimp burritos came with a total of 3 shrimps inside. Food taste good but 2 stars for the mess up. Very bad experience for delivery. Dining in is better

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Pineapple when I asked for meat only
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Only cheese on the elote

sARBDGeIw6Nsb_J9JvAong.text: I like this place a lot and have been coming here since it first opened. Probably have been more than 10 times. The tacos are pretty good and the carne Assad's fries are the bomb. It is not really super traditional Mexican though, more clean eating than something similar like tacos el gordo. The service can be a bit dodgy at time but usually it is pretty decent.

KhB2Qg1_k76FJpK6TVmL3A.text: Yummy, lots of food and inexpensive! There's a learning curve to  ordering. Don't get there too late because the Salas bar disappeared at 10:30. I would recommend this place and definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Sign
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. A girl and her corn.

houlGRl-jCx4JH0Qr68d8g.text: The service here was exquisite (its self serve and I do a damn good job) but the food and staff were definitely not anything to brag about.  Taco truck food at restaurant eatery prices and that's a knock to some taco trucks as I've had better from places that have different locations every week for way less.  It was me, my wife and our 2 kids and our order was 3 corns (2 were elote style), 8 beef tacos, 2 small drinks and a small bowl of rice and beans. Total bill was almost $42  I probably wouldn't mind the bill and leave a negative review if it weren't for the garbage attitude of the staff.  Right away when standing in line to make our tacos, a Hispanic lady was helping serve my wife. My wife, who's speaks very fluent Spanish, heard the employee talking mess about our 1 year old in front of her face. I guess she assumed my wife didn't understand what she was saying but she did. My wife promptly corrected her and continued her order.  Next a man was chopping meat. When requested that he use leaner cuts of meat for our tacos, he looked at my wife and said he didn't speak English. Oh cool. My wife speaks Spanish. She requested in Spanish and he changed nothing. He basically had a "thats not my job" look on his face.  We sat down to eat at dirty tables with 1 ply napkins and not a single rep from the establishment stopped by to see if our order or service was in good standing.  Definitely sticking to trucks next time.

rSy4-ITDwh9vvKZ9tvEWRw.text: Al Pastor is much better than the carne asada for sure. I didn't venture out and try any other meats.   4 stars for a few reasons: -carne asada was just OK. Maybe 3 stars. It wasn't very flavorful and was a little tough.  -corn was really undercooked. I've had better corn at the fair.   Pluses: -horchata was nice -parking wasn't terrible -clean inside -avocado sauce is   -free beans!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Al Pastor is the red one and was a lot better than the carne asada pictures next to it. Corn on the cob was undercooked but hey, free beans!
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Taco Tuesday

R1h5pgjGO4ygA0y2SBA3bQ.text: Love  this place , during the weekends it gets busy but well worth it , i love their Vampiros and Mulas

SJv-IH-0OYmb4W-R0NJrFA.text: First time at this location. It's much newer and nice and open. Plenty of seating upstair and down. It can get really busy but you pretty much get your food as soon as you order it unless you get shrimp or fish, those are cooked to order.  Take a look at the signs up above and get in the line of the items you want, starting from the right and working your way to the left towards the cash register. If you don't want something in that particular line, just skip it.  Tacos look tiny but i ordered 4 and was very full w the additional free beans, escabeche, etc at the salsa bar. I got lengua and cabeza. So good. Cabeza is fattier than lengua which i love and much more juicy, tho i was surprised the juice didn't ruin the tortillas even tho I'm a slow eater. They held up just fine and have a nice chew.  Carrot and onion escabeche is not spicy, but nice and tangy. Grilled onions and jalapeno wasn't to my liking. Too greasy and i felt the peppers were to spicy for me. I'm very sensitive to heat lately tho.   The salsa bar has tons of different kinds. Two greens, three reds, plus limes, radishes, etc.  Some items are pricey. The corn is $3+ but it's so popular. Everyone except me in my group ordered it. Plan on spending about $10/person for a pretty big meal.

qvigNZyf1Iv6_wZivlTqWw.text: Best Mexican food I've ever had. Better than El Faroloto in Mexico City. Ordering sequence takes some getting used to but I could come here once a week.   HUGE selection, super affordable, amazing flavors. Prices are so low you can order 3-5 different things and make an incredible meal. Do t miss the taco y taco lager beer too ... delicious. I'll be back!  Thanks Freddie for the tip

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Gran taco, chorizo taco and lager. Amazing meal...highly recommended!  Taco y Taco is delish!

kRRBHBCJ5fcZlRpTF3AA-g.text: First time eating here and everything was on-the-spot. It wasn't as crowded than expected, the person who made my tacos was really quick making my order and was friendly enough to ask me for any additional toppings or making it extra spicy.  I wouldn't mind going back here next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

-J7lMd2U4iIdDLa0Go9fPQ.text: The burritos are to die for as I have tried the tacos and Nachos and the burrito wins every time. The reason I give it four stars is some of the staff comes off very rude. The avocado salsa is also another great added perk!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

FWeD-UO1reL9cYYzNXykyg.text: These are probably the best tacos I've ever had! The al pastor was delicious and the pineapple they add to it compliments the flavor of the meat perfectly. The atmosphere is also great. The night we went they had a live mariachi band and I thought that was pretty cool. Try this location! You won't be disappointed!!

7dUdAlGq4eil1TY7Ne60sw.text: I really love their tacos. I get 2 chicken tacos with everything on it and it's not spicy which I really appreciate. My only tips for them is to get bottled water and make the lines more clear. Sometimes there won't be a worker standing in the chicken line and I am standing in the pork line thinking the pork guy will help me.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken tacos with everything
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Line

ykZqOnDNsGoqaEXzbYDLkw.text: Definitely more high-end appearing than other taco joints in town, but still serving pretty authentic Mexican street tacos. Prices are not too high overall for food, but probably a little pricey for tacos.  Nonetheless, the flavors are excellent and there is quite an extensive offering. Get into the various different lines to order various different foods. Everything is assembled to order.  There is also a complimentary sauce/condiment bar in the middle of the restaurant. The restaurant itself is quite large and has additional seating upstairs.  Order at the counter, so no table service, though workers will come by to clear things off your table.  I'll definitely return when I'm craving tacos, especially since this place is so close to my house!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Exterior.
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Interior.
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Jamaica, tres tacos (buche, tripa, y cabeza).

2FlmObYA5VstjV1lWcorzQ.text: This is a tough one to review. I had heard a lot of good things about this place, so we gave it a shot. Born & raised in LA, we prefer our hometown taquerias. We've been to Tacos El Gordo in NLV quite a bit, and the style seemed similar. Unfortunately, Taco Y Taco fails miserably in execution and service.    The positives.... The vibe is cool. You walk in and it doesn't feel like a regular taco shop. The taco makers are awesome. Great personalities. There is a small 4-5 seat bar right next to the cashier, and the bartender was slinging some tasty margaritas!  The negatives (the whole process) I went straight to the counter to order, because my 10-year old son and I were starving!!    Stood in line for 5 minutes and finally got to the front. Oops... I need to start in a different line where the food is made.    Oh... and there are 4 lines depending on type of meat. And none of the lines have dividers or make any sense. Nobody in line liked the process. It's confusing. It's annoying.  I started in the Al Pastor line.  Ordered two tacos and a vampiro (a delicious Mexican stacked "sandwich" of hard shell on top and bottom, melted cheese in the middle, meat, sauce).  So good.    Next I worked my way over to the Carne Asade line. Stood there for 7-8 minutes, holding my Al Pastor orders that were getting cold in front of my eyes.  I ordered 6 Carne Asade tacos (meat, guac, sauce, delicious).  The last line was for the elote corn and bean & cheese burrito.  Again, waiting another 5-6 minutes for this line.    After my tray was packed full, I stood back in the cashier line.    This would be like going to MacDonalds, standing in the burger line, then standing in the french fry line, standing in the soda line, and then standing in the cashier line to pay.   In any case, we finally sat down and ate... and the food is good. Not any better than Tacos El Gordo.  Nowhere close to as good as King Taco in LA.  But pretty good.    Now for the fun part...  I needed to get food to go for my wife and other two sons.  So back in line.  Of all the food I originally ordered, we had four tacos leftover that I put on a plate to take home.   10 minutes into the 2nd order, I turn to our table and they had thrown away our food.   WTF?!  I tell the cashier that they had thrown away my food. She says, hold on... she finds the busser and brings him over. He says there were only two tacos and both were half eaten.    This drives me crazy. Why lie? Why bring the busser to the customer? What an awkward situation. They made it right, but that was certainly a bizarre ending to a mediocre dinner experience.

RN6UF3tDQaH325moZ0GA3Q.text: 0 stars actually. I  am so disappointed with this place tonight. I ordered food from a delivery service. My order wasn't made as ordered. I called to have it fixed and the guy actually said "what do you expect me to do?" The guy was a jerk and didn't care at all. Very disappointing.

p8jm2fovrZdELtpm1CjKLQ.text: Pretty good! The food is wonderful! They have many options to choose from. There were a couple of vegan options- i ordered the burrito bowl! The drinks are great; They even have alcoholic beverages!  available. *hint* *hint* And the pricing is very reasonable.  I have two main criticisms:   The lines are very unorganized. I stood in, what looked like to be the vegan line, only to find out I was in the wrong line. So I stood in the other "line" for about 10 minutes until I was served my food. The other line was more of a cluster of people, and it had no particular order. By the time my food was ready, the rest of my party had already been waiting for 20 minutes. I would recommend labeling each line very clearly.   The other criticism is the cleanliness. When I visited, I had to track down a table and wipe it down before eating. I understand Taco Y Taco gets busy, but please make time to clean up between rushes.  Other than that I had a wonderful experience! The food was tasty and filling. The atmosphere is very fun and busy! The bathrooms are well-stocked and clean. I will be back soon! Thank you!

BnvF9PHvHDGgtugtBZ9pCw.text: Food was great, prices were great, but those bathrooms though..... very dirty. Please renovate the bathrooms and have thorough cleaning or checks every 30 mins to an hour.

DN9kvBDtY52bYbOSPqb4GA.text: I used to love this place ! But yesterday was very bad! The Carne Asada was burnt and dry, the Lengua was smelly and had a weird flavor, the horchata was also bad it was thick and it smell like it went bad, it was 8:40 pm so it might been like that the whole day. The sauce bar the limes where already old you can tell cause the skin was brown. And the amount of guacamole they put now is just nothing not even a spoon full.  Sad sad sad !

EOfv3dXcW49uX54NFmTqCg.text: Highly recommend this Taco shop. The best Tacos al pastor ever. They also have Mexican drinks good micheladas! Can't wait to go again.

H1XJI4GlL1E6NrWs3Hq5cQ.text: Omg I can not get enough of this place. Everytime I come to Vegas I must visit this taco place. They have the absolute best tacos, bowls and burritos ever. I have been to many taco place but this one is the best!! The have amazing flavoring and seasoned to perfection. The ladies are so great and very friendly. The owners are sisters and have a few other locations. They're restaurant is a cute little spot with an upstairs. It's a very cut setting. It's a must try if your in Vegas!!! You won't regret it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Chicken tacos

dv7gyD_mOxACIfzF6wmSGg.text: The  one star is for the customer  service  at the burrito  line, I told the guy  dont forget the beans on my burrito  please  and he gets mad and tells me it is  MY job to make sure the first guy wouldn't  forget the beans  because  they are busy to help me and then tells me I should not be over reacting  no need to be rude  to the customer.

Cpu0ep5auZXCfiPHvNrN-Q.text: I have been here a couple of times. I am only docking a star because the lines are super confusing. The first time we went, we were in line over 20 minutes because people kept getting in front of where we were supposed to go. We have finally figured it out, I think?  I like that they have vegetarian options for tacos. I don't eat much meat, so I was especially happy about this. I like the queso fresco one. My husband likes the carne asada tacos, and my son likes the carne asada burrito. I LOVE the Mexican street corn. This is actually the first time in my life I have ever had it, and I was impressed. Yum!  They do have a beer selection, and also Jurritos to drink. Or you can get regular soda. The seating is pretty spread out. You can sit up or downstairs. They have a cart with things like salsa and spicy carrots, like Robertos.   Overall, a little pricey. The lady last night also charged me an extra $2 for a bottled water that we didn't order. Good food though!

8hhXw9roTpbjJ5pEqyDHkQ.text: HANDS DOWN BEST TACOS AND SERVICE IN VEGAS!!! Many good spots in Vegas but this has them all beat!!  Thanks for being a great business! I tell everyone about you guys and bring out of town era EVERY TIME!

Z596boGA6UNA19tDnhyvXA.text: Who's up for Mexican Food? I am!!   We parked, entered the place and tried to figure their ordering system. Basically, it's a food court. Get your food, then pay.  I've had their famous el vampiro (my friends and i didnt really care for this. It's like corn tortilla quesadilla and taco had a baby), al pastor (meat was flavorful and tender, but I got distracted how the sauce looked like. It seemed like alien green, contrasted by the red meat and yellow pineapples), carne asada (it was ok) buche (so moist and yummy) lengua and crispy intestines (i picked on the intestines and didnt eat the taco)   Extra salsa, limes, pickled veggies are in the middle if you care for them.  Anyhow... I am a regular because this place makes mean ELOTES!! Yes, elote con mayonesa, con queso y chile!!! It feels like I'm almost home (I lived in a bordertown in Texas). I dream about eating its goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Tacos
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. Elote

28TJjk5_JGD40EQM_Phz1w.text: OK here's the deal.. before entering, you have to take a deep breath, relax, and tell yourself "Its worth it.. just go to your happy place in your head during the ordering process".  The ordering process is bizarre. They have a line for each type of item. So if you want a pork taco, you wait in the pork line. If you want chicken, you wait in the chicken line. The chicken line might be a 20 min wait while the pork guy is sitting around staring at the crowd, but that's how they do it.  The guy who takes your order is behind a counter and then behind a chopping table , so he's around 8 feet away. It's a loud place, so he wont be able to hear you unless you yell your order. Everyone I have ever ordered from doesn't speak English as their first language, so there's usually a confusing back and forth where they don't understand my order and I don't understand what they are saying. Sometimes they have flour tortillas. Sometimes I ask for flour tortillas and they look at me like I just ordered a nuclear reactor. I just take whatever they are happy to give me.   Why go through the stress of ordering this way? Cuz they make the best damn tacos in Vegas! Give them a try and you will see why its worth it.

LQtL6ejTkFMr0xkMg7QtsA.text: Wow. This is my Mexican spot in Vegas for sure now! First timers and we're really impressed. Not only do they have a wide variety of meats  (cooked authentically if I may add) they offer a lot of vegan and vegetarian options which was the ultimate deciding factor for myself. It was great not having to compromise flavor or food options here. My husband had a bunch of different tacos  (cabeza, Buche,  and pastor) and loved them! And I got the best Soyrizo bowl EVER! Had a nice conversation with a few employees and even found out one of them was from my home city. Great place, food,  and service! Wish there was 1 in L.A.

s9PBrpKXhN5kqXeS5Gltpg.text: Layout is a bit confusing, but tacos are great! Try the Al Pastor, they are the best! Staff is friendly and quick.

yavTiHT4XLEv5JFurLYV1w.text: I've found my new taco place.  Sorry Tacos El Gordo you've been replaced.   More selection, better meats and larger portions. One price for all meats. Exception on seafood of course. Price differs only on item such as taco, vampiro, mula, sope, tostadas, etc...Dining area is more open, lots of tables and better atmosphere. The condiment cart has so many items to choose from.  You don't have to ask for salsa like Tacos El Gordo. They have an upstairs dining area and serve alcohol. Parking is a cluster. Still worth the walk if someone doesn't hit you navigating through the busy parking lot.

GqqY2qbgxZatPCDOMXK6uQ.text: So I decided to go back.  I got the carna taco's this is it!  This is what I like from here.  OMG, this was great.  My husband loves Mexican food, he usually goes to NLV.  I think he's really going to like this place.  He was skeptical about checking it out.  He hates it when he dosn't like something.   So I decided to bring him here for dinner.  (yes, I went 2 times today, Don't judge me)  So I tried to tell my husband to get the tacos, but he went for the burrito.   I got tacos, and there mexican rice.  That rice.........I love rice, almost any kind of rice if it's good, and that rice was good!   So hubby really liked the burrito, but he said he should have listened to me and got the tacos.  So all was good.  We met the owner on the way out, she was super cool, and hella young!    Hubby had surgery, and after he wanted tacos from here.  So I go and get tacos!  Now I really like this place, but it's not very to go friendly!  The girl at the register gave me a plastic bag to put pinto beans in it ( ok, just think about that for a min) really, you don't have a container!  Next time I will bring my own to go container.  I had issues with that!  So I guess, if I'm not going to eat there they my loose some business, because they make it to difficult for me to get what I want to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

snMyVjOBJJH_EhU6ALQF5A.text: Tacos are decent priced and the asade tacos are sooo good. I tried the pork also and it was okay. In addition, I bought a cup of beer with my tacos, and the beer was refreshing. Quick and efficient service. I will be back

O9Sdzeta2cS7QRhk_z3ywQ.text: So, I love Tacos El Gordo (doesn't everyone?!), and I decided to try their partner in crime. I learned that both places have the same owner so I figured Taco Y Taco would be just as tasty. And it was!!!  This place has a few more meat choices than Tacos El Gordo. If you want asada, you must go here since Tacos El Gordo doesn't offer asada. For you gringos and non speaky Spanish people, asada = beef. There are also few other options like asada fries, but be forewarned that they no longer have mole' fries

237byfRGH7PaPyMA3rl_cQ.text: Taco Y Taco seems a little more upscale than your ordinary Hispanic food joint and by that I mean, no drive thru, just dine in and it has two floors. The place looked very nice overall, even from the outside.   I like their food but it doesn't seem any different than if I were to order it from a fast food restaurant. In fact, I think their servings are smaller here and a little more on the pricey side. I'm a fan of al pastor tacos but these were not the best I've had. I would give it a 3/5 for the food.   I do like that they have a good variety of sauces you can grab yourself to add more flavor to their dishes and the full alcohol bar they offer. Something that other places lack.  The music sets the right aura for the place but was a bit too loud for my taste. I felt like I had to yell a little when talking to my friend sitting across from me.   I'm willing to give his place another chance only because my brother seems to like coming here but if the experience is the same, I would probably go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

veByLTck7wQsMVlBJxrxUw.text: 1st timer! Has 3 separate lines for tacos depending on what kind of meat you want.  I love how quick it is and the atmosphere is nice, cool, and modern.  I got the corn, and three tacos and a beer - everything was delicious!

XfgDubBg3bXSqEWKXQQfmA.text: I have at here a few times before. It's a Friday afternoon and it wasn't busy at all. But, I do know this place does get busy.  While there is no direction on where a line starts (can lead to confusion), I believe part of the experience is like ordering street tacos. You walk up an order what you want. I know it's a little unconventional, but I hope this review helps a person who may not be aware.   You do have a nice selection of meats. I tend to order a chicken bowl and sometimes a taco. The food is delicious. In the middle, they have salsas, radishes, limes and other toppings.   I do like the interior. It's got a vintage-like feel to it, high ceilings, and upstairs, and very open seating. This place looks like good cater for an event. It's got the space for it. If you don't feel like staying to eat in, no biggie. Just order what you want and you can take it to go.  By the way, the street corn is delicious.

Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States

ubfzngSZ2mRiLWbKzSYyKA.text: Delicious food.   The ordering lines are a bit confusing. I had the Al Pastor taco and burrito so I had to stand in Lines 1 and 4.  Reminds me of the DMV hahah.

LcxgHTibeZ-9ehIk4xx5bA.text: Tasty affordable Mexican in a nicer than usual space.  The carnitas was delicious and the lengua had that lengua tang.  The habanero salsa is a perfect blend of heat and flavor.    My only complaint is that the portions are huge.  I'm ready for a nap.

SsIqrmu_MU81HdRs6aPo9g.text: food is good enough when we're  craving authentic mexican food and dont want to drive to north town or cook, only downfall is the system in which to actually order your food, there are 4 different lines you must stand in to get different things, and by the time you get everything and stand in every different line and finally pay at the cashier, the tacos are already cold... come on guys, its been a couple years, please fix this stupid problem... k thanks!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. tacos and elotes and quesadillas and micheladas!!!
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Taco Y Taco - Henderson, NV, United States. yummm

nQYpbADh4l1aI2V6YlZzWg.text: 2016 Yelp 100 Review Challenge -     16/100  I RARELY give 1 star reviews.   I love Mexican food and surprisingly I have never been here till last night. Well........... lucky me, I found out why...   I was craving Mexican food and my friend suggested this place. She said she liked the tacos here.   It's an upscale taco joint. 2 floors and large open spaces with lots of tables and a bar. Great for big parties.   There must have been something in the air here, because as soon as we got in line...someone in front of us was complaining about something and it held up the line about 10 minutes. The way it's set up, there's a taco counter and an everything else counter (elote, burrito, nachos, etc.) There was one guy serving at each counter. And two of them, was helping her for 10 minutes. Three other guys in the back cooking and two at the cash register. They were fully staffed but no organization or management.   There was already a line of people complaining and asking, "are you guys in line? is this the line?" Apparently, they aren't organized. Other places, they could have a line out the door and the service would still be faster than this place.   I was craving for a burrito, but I wanted to try the Al Pastor tacos. I wanted to see how it compares to other places. I got three with everything on it. About $8.  $2.25 each taco + tax. Pricey for a taco. Most places are a dollar something.   When I ordered, the guy had an attitude and was obviously pissed with the customer he just dealt with...and I was doing my best to be kind, smile and be understanding... but I got pissed when he just threw the tacos on my tray. It splattered and left a mess. W.T.F.   And up next, we had to wait in another line just to get an elote (Mexican street style corn on a stick). that took another 10 minutes. Because there was only one guy working that counter... he was on point and had great service, the only one that had great customer service.   The tacos were Bland, flavorless, lifeless... in the al pastor meat and sauce. And the pineapple doesn't taste like pineapple. The toppings didn't make it any better.  I was disappointed. So very disappointed with the food and service. I should've just went to Roberto's, Cafe Rio, or Fausto's near by. And at $2.25 a taco... it was so not worth the $8.   Before we left, we asked for a takeout box.  Turns out they are charging $1 for a takeout box. So my friend ended up getting a foil and a bag. Cashier was rude about it as well. Attitude problem.   That pissed me off because every other restaurant anywhere... takeout boxes are FREE.   I will not be back again. The food is pricey, tasteless and service sucks.   I'd rather drive all the way to the Strip or north side for Tacos El Gordo than eat here again.
